description:
"I dream of painting and then I paint my dream." - Vincent Van Gogh 

Location: The Sunset District, San Francisco, CA. 

This magical place has nothing to do with Vincent Van Gogh, yet it has everything to do him: Unbelievable creativity & unwavering passion. 

The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps ahhh... Okay, before I get carried away... there's a difference between one of the greatest painters the world has ever seen, and a community public park in a San Francisco neighborhood. A project started by the residents... oh that creativity & passion! You made it happen! 

Once again the serendipity card comes into play as I find myself in the area after visiting my old home on 19th Ave. It's amazing to know this work of working art is in my old neighborhood. In 2003, a grassroots effort led by residents to create a "sea to stars" themed mosaic art flowing up 163 steps began. Two years later it was open to the public for all to enjoy! The Gardens to the south was donated by Alice Yee Xavier one of the dreamers of the stairway to Heaven! And as beautiful as it is... it's still absolutely free to all... 

On my visit I couldn't help but stop at almost every step. As many are now memorials for loved ones. Some dedicated to SFPD, to "Mom", to others in the community. Some tile art are of whimsical animals like frogs, fish, hummingbirds, snakes, and insects. Flowers seem a popular subject too. And the stars, yes the stars! The imagination ran wild here, and yes, in a very good way! I really enjoyed my walk! 

In the end, I highly recommend The 16th Ave Tiled Steps for all to enjoy. It's a great spot for photo-ops and to just enjoy the day. Thank you neighbors! In a way, the residents of my old neighborhood just wanted people to reconnect with people. In today's world we sometimes forget the human element and the artist that lives in us all... 

"Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well." - Vincent Van Gogh
author: Eric R.

description:
To be honest, this spot was underwhelming. We got there around noon on a Saturday and found parking no problem. Unfortunately, in true SF fashion, there was a lot of overcast so we weren't able to get that "beautiful panoramic view" of the city as many have mentioned in their reviews. Another couple told us it would clear up in a couple of hours but we weren't planning on waiting it out. 

163 steps sounded daunting but they were not intense at all. I wouldn't even consider it a workout. We even saw some elderly folks walking up - good for them! Including the additional side stairs, we breezed through this place in roughly 10 minutes.

Sure the tiles were pretty and we took some not-IG-worthy pics. I guess I'm glad to say been there, done that but it was so anticlimactic that I almost feel it was a waste of time! Maybe I'd sing a different song if we caught a sunset otherwise I would not recommend putting this on your list of things to check out.
author: Bee N.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend while hitting all the hidden gem spots around SF! We came here around 4pm on a Saturday and there were a good number of other tourists taking photos on the beautiful tile steps. The lighting was nice at the time as well. Gotta get that perfect Instagram pic, so we asked other tourists to take pictures for us and they were all very friendly. We got dropped off by Uber at the top of the stairs, and I recommend that if you don't want to walk up the stairs from the bottom. 

Side note: Some tiles towards the middle of the staircase had names written on them, and it did make me a little curious about the story behind those names.
author: Cherin K.

description:
Get those IG worthy shots or your next profile picture here! You have many options on backgrounds since each section of the stairs have different tiles!

I recommend starting from the top of the stairs and working your way down. That way you have the tile design revealed to you. First, you are rewarded with the beautiful view of the San Fran city from above. Then, it was excited to see what was going to be at the bottom of the stairs. After each section of the stairs have been revealed and you take that last step at the bottom, you are finally rewarded with the beauty of piecing all the tiled section together to make one beautiful art piece!

Highly recommend visiting this tourist spot. Just be careful where you park and lock your cars when you leave. I saw lots of signs for people to make sure to hide their belongings or take them with you to avoid any thefts. Just be safe and take in this beautiful view!
author: Rina I.

description:
It's gorgeous and a must see. But forget about a picture without others in the background lol.
Most don't know about Grandview Park which is right above it. I recommend to include that in your visit!!
author: Apple S.

description:
It's a fun place to visit if you are in the area but the stairway is not really that long like Filbert Steps or Greenwich Stairway. You can go all the way to the top of Granview Park if you want to continue going up. It was SUPER windy up there on top of the Granview Park. Like really really windy , everyone on top was screaming . Felt like I was going to be blown away lol. 

Both sides of the stairway is beautifully landscaped with flowers , tree and cacti. There were some black succulent which I had never seen before. Really interesting succulents there. 

There were some signs on the streets about car break ins. Car windows have been smashed and valuables stolen while parked in the neighborhood even though this neighborhood is not a bad neighborhood. So be careful and make sure to take your valuables with you.
author: Korina Y.

description:
I was on a trip to SF and we wanted to check out all the main touristy spots and stumbled upon the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps. These steps are the ones you find all over instagram when you search up San Francisco and are posted everywhere for a reason! The mosaic/tile steps tell a story with the bottom of the steps depicting the ocean and the top of the steps encompassing the moon, stars, and outerspace. We made our way all the way to the top to find a breathtaking view of San Francisco!

There are a lot of tourists who come by taking pictures so make sure you get there early in the morning or at a time that's not considered primetime in San Francisco to get the best picture. It was a little odd because these steps are located in the middle of a residential neighborhood in San Francisco surrounded by houses.
author: Brittany E.

description:
The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps are both a set of beautiful stairs depicting various art pieces and a way to get a great view! 

We came here on a Wednesday late morning, so we were easily able to find some street parking and walk uphill a bit to the stairs. There weren't many other tourists/locals around, so it was easy to take some great pictures! There are about 9 stairs per set until you reach the sun/moon set, when it suddenly increases to about 18/20 stairs for those sets. It's definitely a hike all the way up to the top, but the view is breathtaking! Make sure to stop here if you are in San Francisco!
author: Liselle L.

description:
The steps are BEAUTIFUL and so detailed

There's a nice little view at the top of the stairs
But if you continue to go up the concrete stairs and then the wooden ones after that, you get a really spectacular view
author: Mai L.

description:
Great place for photos! It's fascinating to see the tiles and the plants. The view on top is amazing!
However, there aren't much to do except for enjoying the view and take photos. If you're looking for a place to relax and breathe in San Francisco landscape, this is the place to be!
author: Ngoc Tran D.

description:
Are you thinking about getting a new Facebook (or dating) profile picture? Well your opportunity is here! The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps project originally started in 2003 and opened to public on August 2005. The 163-step stairway is a very popular SF photo destination and the view from the top is absolutely spectacular on a day without fog. Thankfully these steps aren't as long as Filbert Steps and Lyon Street Steps (not to mention this is the only one out of the three steps with mosaic tiles) and we stayed here for about 15 minutes.

Finally there is street parking and you will also see signs say "Daytime car burglary zone - it only takes 20 seconds!! Leave nothing in your car". We utilized ridesharing apps so this wasn't an issue for us. Beside the potential car burglary issue, The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps is a must-visit and this is one of those places you will just have to see for yourself.
author: Luke L.

description:
This was probably one of my favorite places in San Fran. Despite the fact that it was free to visit, the history and dedication these people went through to build this intricate detailed staircase is absolutely amazing. 

The weather was perfect and they don't suggest you parking on the street because there are a lot of break ins around the area, so if you do park on the street do not leave your valuables in your car. 

I would definitely recommend this attraction to anybody visiting because it is so pretty and detailed and the story behind it is even more interesting. Plus it was a free attraction (can't beat that) and the weather was so pretty.
author: Krystine S.

description:
SF scenic spot

Day tripping in San Francisco with a cloudy forecast on a Saturday afternoon we stopped by this beautiful tiled steps on 16th Avenue, just West of Grand View Park. You have to catch it at a good time to find the steps empty with tourists and locals. When is a good time? I'm not sure... maybe on a very early morning. We parked nearby. Only street parking available since it is located in a residential neighborhood but beware! there are more than one sign that warns of car break-ins. Do not leave valuables in plain sight. Common sense, right? We didn't have any trouble.

We walked up towards the steps. The foot of the steps had beautiful succulents on a plant bed and a sign that read:

"Many hands created this mosaic which pays homage to loved ones and the spirit of community." (see photo)

There are 163 steps and going up is a nice view of sea and stars design. The beautiful tile work have personal messages to a friend or a loved one. There are a few landings in between and the surrounding garden with the plants in season is lovely and well maintained by the community. Lots of photos opps by visitors including me! Nice climb up and once you reach the top enjoy the views of the city. Wish I could see the steps at night... it is said that the tiled steps glow at night from the moonlight... does it? Is it true?? ... anyone??

Review #0976
author: May A.

description:
A beautiful corner of the West Bay which, as the name implies, features a long flight of steps that are tiled to form several large mosaics as you go up (or down). It would conceivably be a great way to exercise if you're into stair-climbing, but enough word has gotten out that there are plenty of picture-takers obstructing traffic flow.

Nevertheless, if you're not exercising or pressed for time, this is a nice way to get some inclined steps in with some Instagram exhibitionism.
author: Vincent L.

description: We visited the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps in June. We went first thing in the morning and there was nearby street parking in the residential area. There were very few people, so we were able to take many photos. It is advisable to lock your car and put valuables into the trunk of your car as the sign reminded us. At the top of the stairs there are more stairs that leads up to the top of the hill. The community garden is well cared for and is amazing, full of local plants. The stairs are beautiful and worth a visit.
author: Beáta Z.

description:
Pssst....come here....

You wanna know a great local secret?

The inner Sunset has secret stairs all over the place: mainly in Forest Hills (https://stairwayfreedom.weebly.com/san-francisco-stairways/category/forest%20hill%20stairways) and Golden Gate heights (https://stairwayfreedom.weebly.com/san-francisco-stairways/category/golden%20gate%20heights)...but there are other places (https://stairwayfreedom.weebly.com/san-francisco-stairways/category/all).

Perhaps the most famous are the 16th Ave tiled steps. First started in early 2000's the stairs are a magnificent example of tiling...but wait there's more.

The stairs lead to an unbelievable view of the outer Sunset, Daly city, Outer Richmond, Ocean beach, and the Marin Head lands.

MY ONLY TIP IS: DON'T LEAVE ANYTHING IN YOUR CAR...THERE ARE CONSTANT BREAK INS!!!!
author: David G.

description:
Directions took us to the bottom of Moraga Street, flights of stairs got me winded but it is worth the spectacular views of the city.
Weather was warm so tolerable as we got to top we had light jackets for the wind.
There are shady trees, wood barriers to rest on, and a single bench,
There are flights of stairs and cement walkway down to tile steps, but once you get there you'll find it to be a magnificent piece of art.
I took pictures in sections down the steps, and a shot of stairs from the bottom 
Plenty of visitors, so you kind of have to time you portraits 
I understand there are a second set of steps with a different scene, so I will most likely return to view those.
Be prepared to do a lot of walking up & down steps unfortunately there are no disabled access.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Great place to bring friends and family from out of town for a nice view of the city. (If the weather allows) Be sure to wear a hat and good shoes. I normally take the steps from Moraga Ave & 16th but just recently discovered a quicker way from my apartment from Kirkham St & 16th (Hidden Garden Steps) then left onto Lawton at the top of the steps (or just google search Grandview Park as I did hehe)

I'd still pick Twin Peaks view over Grandview Park but the steps are cool to see all the different artwork and tiles... and less crowded!!!
author: Ashley Renee B.

description:
Wow! So worth getting lost and almost peeing in my pants to visit these steps. It is beautiful.

The steps are located right next to Grandview park. So if you get lost, just walk to the bottom of the wooden steps and it'll be slightly to your right, across the street. I would recommend visiting these stairs and Grandview Park for a nice view of the city.
author: Candy W.

description:
Review #118 - 2018

Lately, I've been doing a lot more touring of our own area since I've been so ashamed of the fact that I've lived all almost all of my life and still haven't actually visited the majority of our touristy spots.

I told my nephew that I'm going to try and visit every single San Francisco tourist spot before the end of 2018, which might be impossible; but I'll do my best to hit as many spots as I possibly can.

This spot was also bookmarked a little while ago, so since we were already at the Lincoln Park Steps, I thought we might as well check this spot off of my bookmarks.

I actually had a really hard time finding it because the address on Yelp might be wrong so Apple map took me to some where completely different.

Thank goodness, I'm pretty good with directions so I just kept driving and found the place without the help of my reliable GPS.

The steps are so beautiful here!  The neighborhood is nice as well.  I actually feel kind of bad for the people who live nearby since there were so many people & cars while we were there.

We didn't spend a whole lot of time there, but we still got a decent amount of photos.

This was our last tourist spot for the night before heading out for some ice cream.

Definitely worth the drive, even though we got lost got a little while.
author: Sivilay T.

description:
BEAUTIFUL VIEW AT THE TOP, you can see the entire skyline of San Fransisco. You gotta climb up all the stairs (not only tiled steps) but also some cement stairs to get up and across the street, and then finally some winding wooden stairs to see the view at the top of the park. Definitely a good workout LOL.

The tiled steps are pretty but they can be a little underwhelming if that's the only thing you're coming for. I think the view at the top is a must if you're here already!
author: Joleen H.

description:
This 163 step stairway with mosaic tiles is pretty cool and definitely worth checking out if you are looking to explore San Francisco and also get some exercise. 

The directions led me to Moraga St and 11th St where I parked, but the steps are actually located on Moraga St between 15th and 16th St. I don't have any regrets about where I parked though since I got a good workout hiking over to the steps through Grandview Park.

If you start at the top of the steps on 15th St you won't notice the mosaic tiles and they will look like a regular staircase through a residential neighborhood. At first I thought I might be in the wrong place until I walked down the steps and then walked up again and saw the mosaic tiles while walking up.

I walked up the steps without stopping and someone complimented me as I finished and asked if I walked them everyday. Ha! It is a good workout though especially if you pair it with a hike in Grandview Park too which is located just north of the steps. 

I would definitely come back here again either by myself or to show it to others.
author: Regina W.

description: Must visit when you are in San Francisco! Not only are the tiles amazing and unique, the views are spectacular. 163 fantastic steps that lead you to amazing vistas. Not packed with people so a good alternative kind of hidden attraction.
author: Mark J.

description:
Tourist hot spot! Be warned come early before all the tourists arrive if you want to catch some good shots. Defiantly an IG photo Mecca for all you photo selfie lovers. But the view from the top is also beautiful. It's worth the walk up all those steps just to look over SF all the way to the beach. 

If you looking for these steps don't get duped by the first set of tile steps! Those are not the steps! Yes they are tiled and it's also a long walk up but those are not it. Walk up those steps and then continue through a housing community. Then you'll reach the true 16th ave tiled steps. Once you see the bronze sign that's when you know those are the ones. Luckily there were only a few people there and we got to take some great shots of the stairs. These mosaic steps are just incredible. And the time it took to place each piece is just mind boggling. Once at the time we sat and looked out at the city for a minute. It's a breath taking view of the city and coastline. 

If you in town and haven't seen these steps it's worth coming to see at least once. Best the tourists and come early.
author: Karen H.

description: My fiancé brought me here since he wanted me to see these cool steps that I never knew existed. It was fun walking all the way to the top and coming back down. Beautiful area and fun place to chill for a bit!!!! Not only do you get a workout on but you get to enjoy the beautiful view when you get to the top. Def worth checking this place out!
author: Neloffer E.

description:
I love how the neighborhood came together to create such a beautiful piece of usable art.   The inscriptions, names, and quotes make it so personal and heart-warming and the view from the top is fabulous!  It was bright blue, cloudless day and we can see forever.   Fun stop on this day of "obscure SF tourist spots"!

Note:
I should've read YELP reviews because they are spot on!
It was difficult for us to find! We followed the GPS which led us to Moraga St.      We were with two people who couldn't walk too far so my daughter and I climbed a million steps up before realizing we weren't even close.  Climbed back down the steps, got in the car, and drove around a little bit to find the TOP  of the 16th Ave steps.    We walked down, admired the artistry of the tiles, took our photos, then made the 163-step trek back up to our parking spot.   (As has been described, it can be pretty hard to find parking.)    We drove off and only then did we realize we could've started at the base of the steps and had the whole view without walking.    So we parked again at the base and our two other visitors were able  to see the steps.  Lesson learned.
author: Heidi D.

description: This place was pretty easy to find once you see crowds of people. From top to bottom, there is a great view across houses and buildings. The day I went, it was foggy and cold but still had a great time taking photos with my friends. There are quite a few different murals, maybe about 6 or 7 (I don't remember exactly). My favorite was the third from the top! I recommend coming here if you want to take a new profile picture.
author: Jessica T.

description: This is a good hidden spot in sf.  These steps lead to other stairs which leads to one of the best views of the city. It's a close walk to golden gate park as well
author: Michael M.

description: I have seen so many Instagram posts on those stairs but never knew where it is. My friends and I stumbled upon it while driving towards Presidio. Beautiful stairs with gorgeous view of San Francisco. If you go to the top of the stairs and keep going up the hill, there is a great vista point where you can see the whole view of Golden Gate Park, Golden Gate Bridge and San Francisco! Very creative design, love it!
author: Rachel G.

description:
These steps are a MUST! It's super cool to turn about after each flight of stairs and see the tiles all together. However, the grand finale at the bottom is the best view! It's so creative and I love the colorful mosaics. Totally worth seeing! Super unique and haven't seen something like this anywhere else! 

Gotta check it out!
author: Evelina K.

description:
Neighborhood gem!

The artistry of the mosaic tiles is amazing considering this is in a residential area, and not in an art gallery. The stairs are very well maintained, so definitely climb up to the top to check out the view.

I went during peak tourist time (weekend afternoon) so there was a crowd at the stairs, but if you want a photoshoot without anyone around, I'd recommend coming really early on a weekday. Since this is located in a private residential street, please be respectful!

I'd bring friends visiting the area to this spot!
author: Sylvia Y.

description:
If you're into scenic viewpoints and free local landmarks, you definitely have to check out the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps. This local stairway is located on Moraga Street. Surprisingly, it was not too crowded when we decided to check it out. Definitely a lot easier if you park at the bottom of the steps; that way, you'll get to enjoy the view of the steps before you actually climb them. 

Each individual step is already unique in its own way, but when you take the entire staircase in as a whole, all the steps come together seamlessly. It creates a really beautiful picture - very similar to the ebb and flow of the ocean. It's really awesome how there are these beautiful treasures hidden throughout San Francisco - who would have known? 

Even better is after you climb the entire staircase, you're able to take in the view of SF from a higher vantage point. If you come around sunset, you'll really be able to see the city view with the soft, warm glow of the sun as it casts a shadow over SF before it becomes engulfed in darkness. 

It'll be a bit difficult to get a good picture without anybody blocking the view or intruding in your photo, but it's worth the wait! There seem to be rushes of people to these tourist-y spots, so wait for a chance where the crowd seems to be minimal and grab your opportunity to get that shot! 

tl;dr - Highly recommend you check this place out if you're in to scenic things to do in SF! You'll be glad you did.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I'm blessed to have some great friends in San Fran. I used to have family here in SF and often visited. But they never took me to the 16th Ave Tiled Steps. 

Friend called it the Mosaic Steps. She wanted to do some last minute sightseeing before my flight home. 

The drive here was minimal but she drove so what do I know right. You drive up a tiny hill and find parking. You can't miss the steps. We were lucky that the steps weren't busy that Monday morning. There were few tourists. 

Friend said I could go all the way up to see views but we were on a time crunch so we only went up half way and then took pictures. 

We even helped a lone tourist take pics of herself with her camera. There are just some really nice people in this city. 

Anyhow, it was great finally visiting this attraction and I hope to visit again to check out the view on top.
author: Faye L.

description:
I was so excited to come check these steps out and they were absolutely stunning. Next time I'll be coming back early in the morning to avoid the crowd because it will get packed with people later in the day. There was plenty of parking spots upstairs and downstairs.

I love the different designs, but it all intertwines and makes one piece. It's really unique. You can take pics and get a good hike in. After finishing taking photos here, you can hike up and get the whole city during sunset or a nice view of the city.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Anh L.

description: A little hidden gem in San Francisco. Beautiful art work! We parked on the other side of the steps so we had to ask how to get to the mosaic steps. It was worth the exercise. Loved the views
author: Mari M.

description: This is one of my favorite things to see whenever I'm in the city! It's hidden in a quiet neighborhood & surrounded by beautiful succulents planted by the community. The mosaic steps are so detailed and it's incredible to see. When you are at the bottom, you're able to see the steps that lead to the park at the top. Each section of the mosaic is different the higher you go! The biggest treat is when you get to the top. You're able to see a view of the city, as long as Karl the fog isn't out to play! If you're looking for a hidden gem to take great pictures of, this is your place. I would consider this a tourist spot for the next time you come to the city!!
author: Ysabelle O.

description:
We enjoy playing tourist in San Francisco, since there is so much to see.  The famous 16th Avenue Tiled Steps is one of those hidden gems that's definitely worth spending a half hour or so, for tourists and locals alike. If you have decent knees and are in moderate shape, it will not be a hard workout, only 160 steps or so.  When you reach the top, I highly recommend taking the additional stairs to the top of Grandview Park.  Its a small, circular park that will give you a breath-taking panoramic view of the city.

Other tips:
* There seems to be plenty of street parking everywhere, or folks can take Uber or cab (About a $20 ride from Embarcadero).  Lots of warning signs about car thieves frequenting the area.

* Because of the crowds, don't recommend jogging up/down.  

* There are no restrooms or stores nearby to get water - closest shops are maybe 10-15 minute walk down to 19th Avenue and Noriega.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Flying cross country to San Fran I knew we were in for a treat.  We had heard so many great things about the city - I was so excited to spend a few days exploring.  It wasn't until our 2nd to last day that we took the bus cross town to see these famous steps and I had no idea that it would end up being one of my favorite spots in the city for three reasons: 

#1 The steps are unassuming. You get off the bus and you're in a legit residential neighborhood with houses all around.  I love spots like this - it felt like 'local flavor' at its finest.  

#2 The tile work is AMAZING! And I love how it felt like they were telling a story as you walked up.  Such craftsmanship and such support from the community - these steps are BEAUTIFUL! 

#3 When we finally got to the top and turned around to see the view - it was definitely one of those 'wow' moments.  The view from the top is pretty spectacular and photos don't do it justice. you've got to see it for yourself.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
The tiled steps are so pretty, definitely IG photo opp. Parking in the area is a hit or miss since it's a residential area. Park at the bottom of the stairs and slowly walk up the tiled steps enjoying the beautiful flowers planted on either side of the stairs. When you reach the top of the steps, make sure you cross the street and head to Grand View Park. Climb the series of wooden steps and take in the beautiful SF view.

I've dropped by a few times.. it's definitely more packed on a sunny day. The other two times I dropped by were overcast & very windy/chilly so there weren't that many people.
author: Ruby C.

description:
Had a lot of funny coming here today. When we first showed up, there were about 4 other couples here taking photos. Everyone was very respectful, we each took turns taking panoramic photos. We took a walk up the steps making sure to focus on each flight of steps and how unique they were. Make sure to walk to the top, the sight is amazing! You get a good view of the city.
On a side note, many of the neighbors are very friendly. We brought our dog and we got many compliments and which started many conversations. Overall had a very good experience.
author: Jermaine C.

description: I loved this landmark! It was pretty crowded though for a Monday afternoon (around 1:30pm). There are signs EVERYWHERE that say it's a high burglary area so be prepared to leave NOTHING in your car. Thieves know this is a landmark that takes time to walk all the way up and down, and they take advantage of that. The view from the top is amazing (: also lots of pretty flora along the way.
author: Emma P.

description:
First time a few weeks back and definitely a must see! 

Stopped here and ended walking up all the steps to a great view. Make sure to take pictures!
author: Elaine C.

description: Came here the other day to enjoy the artwork the other day and it just so happened we came right before the sunset. We climbed all the way to the top of the stairs and watched beautiful sunset with the view of the city in the background, it was great. My friend and I definitely took in the view and the quiet serenity at the top that day.
author: Christina P.

description: Very popular spot. Went there during the week and there were about five people there for photo ops.
author: Betsy G.

description: Very cool public art. Probably not worth a trip too far out of your way but if you're passing by give it a look!
author: Dave L.

description: This unique and hidden gem is located in a residential area. Although this isn't a main tourist attraction, it's a must do for everyone when in San Francisco! The tiled steps are pretty cool and super colorful. We went all the way to the top where the view is beautiful! I could imagine how amazing it would look right before sunset. It wasn't hard to find parking which was a plus. Whoever designed this is very creative! This is probably one of the coolest places to see in San Francisco and ... it's free! Yes, I said free.
author: Jovete E.

description:
Amazing place... You get breath taking views from the bottom of the stairs and as you climb the stairs the view only gets better. At the top, you are rewarded with sweeping views of the Sunset district with a cool fresh air breeze. Walk another block up and walk up another 100+ flight of stairs and the view gets better; you can see part of the golden gate bridge.

Be forewarned that the neighbors here are very respectful of their neighborhood so please keep it clean and don't steal the plants! Also this is a tourist attraction so keep your valuables out of sight.
author: Eric T.

description: Lovely place to chill, walk, and take pictures! Fortunately, the day we went was a sunny day in the city of San Francisco. The skies were clear and blue. The view of the SF skyline was breathtaking! This scenic spot is in a neighborhood, so parking is sparse. You'll have to park on the side streets and walk. I was glad to see this little spot clean, considering the amount of people who come and visit. I'm all for enjoying views, but I also make sure to take my trash with me. I couldn't recall if there were any nearby trash cans here for those who bring food to enjoy.
author: Kara M.

description:
Love it. 
Came here on Friday in the morning with my dogs. 
Easy to find parking space. 
A lot of tourists were already on the steps taking pictures. 
Once you reached the top, if you keep going, you will enter grandview park. The view is really awesome but it's kind of windy and cold. So be prepared to bring jacket if you wanna go.
author: Tina H.

description:
Awesome art deco steps at the heart of sfo. At the top of the steps gives you a breathtaking view of the city.  Below looking up is a majectic view of the intricately tiled steps....

Nice quiet neighborhood with ample free street parking. Safe as lots of families and local people milling about .

A must see for sure when visiting sfo!

Tip: when entering in gps - enter - "16th ave" then just follow the road and ask a local..you cant miss it. 16th ave is a short street. 

Cheers
author: Jon L.

description: Man this place was one of the best places for a view. The steps were beautiful and well kept. We took an Uber to get here. There are 2 sets of steps. The first ones are the tiled steps.  And the second one  are wooden steps that takes u even higher for the view. It would be a great place to propose to someone or for a romantic picnic. I would have thought that it was going to have trouble getting a picture on the steps without tourists but I guess the other tourists don't know about this place. They all went to the Lyons steps!!! Bring a snack and some water bc you're going to get out of breath going all the way up both sets of steps. I went on a Wednesday so I went to the outdoor farmers market before going to the tiled steps. I brought a water and a peach with me. I left the seed so if there's a peach tree there in a few years, you're welcome San Francisco.
author: Ciara N.

description:
Amazing beautiful art done on the steps! This is by far the best steps I have ever been too. Amazing spot, not to be missed while you are in the city. I am surprised how I didnt find this place earlier. I am gonna recommend this to all my fnds and family whenever they visit SF in the future. I am love with these tiled steps and the views from the top which is breath-taking. It can get pretty chilly at the top even on a sunny day. Make sure to always carry a jacket. There is a small hike once u go on the top of these steps. Make sure to go beyond the step-tiles top to appreciate the view even more than what it appears from the top of these steps. This place is a must-visit for all photography freaks around!

Beautiful place in the city but make sure to be prepared to deal with the parking situation while going to this place!
author: Jaya W.

description: Absolutely beautiful. We lucked out, we were the only ones there, so we were able to see the entire stairway unobstructed. The succulents were just as colorful and pretty. Thank you for maintaining this gem for us to enjoy.
author: Christie I.

description:
Finally!!! I've been wanting to visit for years and it happened. Located in an uphill neighborhood and may be a little difficult to find. The moment you arrive, the first glance of the stairs will feel surreal. Definitely look at every tile detail on the stairs because there's beauty in every single one. Different colors, styles, meaningful notes written on the tiles, and the reflection of the sun through some of the glass tiles. We were lucky enough to be the only ones there but as we were leaving it started getting packed. A great location for pictures and to take a moment of peace and quiet to soak it all in. 

Once you get to the top of the stairs, the view of the city is breathtaking and rewarding. Take a couple of minutes to sit down and enjoy it. Grand View Park is walking distance from the top of the mosaic tile steps. The stairs to the park is to your left. Just as beautiful and feels like you're visiting a national park! It'll be a great location to have a picnic :)
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Such a wonderful sight to see! I love artistic things like this, especially if you can get a workout in (lol kinda) the details on each step are amazing. It seems like the bottom of the steps are like the ocean with fish on every step, working your way up the stairs to the sky with stars, the moon, and the sun at the top. I love it! 

We visited on a gloomy Sunday afternoon and it wasn't too busy. We easily found parking a couple houses from the steps. *Remember your written driving test question about which way you turn your wheel if you decide to park on a hill! 

You can get a picture with the steps without anyone in the background if you wait off to the side. If not, turn around and get a picture with the view of the water and the beautiful San Francisco homes. I recommend sitting two steps below the moon to make it seem like you're sitting on the moon LOL. 

The tiled steps are a must see if you want to play tourist in San Francisco!
author: Remelyn S.

description:
What do you get when you climb up thousands of pretty colored steps? 
-A mediocre view and sore legs.

Although the steps themselves were pretty, the walk it took to get there and the view itself weren't nice enough to make all that effort worth it. Instead of appreciating the view and the steps, I found myself breathing heavily and in need of a nap.
author: Jade L.

description: Awesome location! Beautiful view of homes, roads, and of course the mosaic steps. We ended up at the top of the stairs, walked our way down, and came back up just to get a picture. Very calm and relaxing at the top of the hill. Highly recommend for walkers. It just makes you happy looking at the stairs as you go up!
author: Sandy L.

description:
If you're around the Sunset and are looking for something to do, go to Golden Gate Park. Just do it, you can easily spend a whole day there.

After you've done that, though, stop by the 16th Ave Tiled Steps. They're a neat little gem hidden in the hills of SF perfect for taking pictures (see the 1500+ already posted). Get a new Facebook profile picture on the steps, a banner at the top looking over the city, and some Insta followers by slapping a B&W filter on a macro of some flowers. It wasn't too crowded when I went, which to be fair was late afternoon during SF's hottest day on record. They're not as tall as you think, and any able-bodied individual should be able to climb them without issue.
author: Shawn W.

description: These steps are gorgeous and quite the exercise. I am a very unfit individual so it was quite difficult to climb all the way up without getting out of breathe. But it is so pretty and the view is amazing. The hill on top of the stairs is even better and worth the extra climb.
author: Ellen G.

description:
Beautiful work and so well done! 
Don't get these confused with the hidden garden steps, also on 16th, which are also great. Google maps conveniently took us by them on the way to these steps. 

It's very busy here and lots of reports of cars being broken into. Good thing we were using uber and walking.
author: Rowena B.

description:
What a beautiful staircase! I've been seeing lots and lots of photos of this tourist attraction and had to go find it. It's smack dab center in the residential area of the Sunset district. Very limited parking but it seems that there's lots of turn over parking since it's 50/50 tourists and people who actually live on 16th Ave.
I didn't climb the staircase but heard it's around 100 steps. I highly suggest stopping by here!
author: Sahar N.

description:
Just as I imagined. I've been wanting to cross this off my "places to visit" list for some time. We took an uber from BART. Ended up walking up a hill before we found the stairs. The views are wonderful! 

The sun sets directly across from the steps. So the artwork is illuminated by it. Incredible piece of art this is. And a great work out to walk up and down. 

If you haven't come to see these steps yet, I hope you find your way here soon!
author: Melanie B.

description:
A must-see spot in SF and I love coming here! This is probably one of the best places for a photo op in SF. The steps are gorgeous, and the view at the top is equally gorgeous. The stairs can be a little hard to find, and parking might be tricky. Google Maps dropped me off at the top of the steps, so I wasn't able to see how beautiful the steps were until I walked down a couple dozen steps. I ended up walking up and down the stairs a few times because I was so in awe of how beautiful everything is. 

The steps look kinda long but it only takes a few minutes to go from the bottom to top (or vice versa) if you don't stop. I saw a lot of locals come here to run up and down the stairs for exercise!
author: Christina C.

description: This was fun. It's just steps but they were so neat.  And the view from the top was amazing. We only spent about 30 minutes here but I would go back just for fun.
author: Danyelle H.

description: Beautiful Artistic steps! Definitely an IG photo op! I went on a bright sunny day and luckily it was pretty empty! Had the opportunity to take some cool photos.  Very easy accessible by bus, there's a stop right in front of it.
author: Princess B.

description:
Easily one of my favorite places in San Francisco! The art on the steps are so vibrant, beautiful and aesthetically pleasing. As you climb the stairs, you will notice that every set has a different design that coordinates perfectly with the ones before and/or after. The view as you're stepping higher and higher is even more beautiful but I would suggest waiting until you reach the top. Be sure to bring a light jacket because it can get very windy. 

P.S. Don't stop there. Climb even more steps at the Grand View Park for the ultimate view.
author: Jobelle A.

description:
It is tucked away in the midst of small streets and difficult terrible parking.

The stairs itself is quite spectacular. Very creative and beautiful and I have to give mad props and lots of respect to the artists and creators. 

Beautiful place for photo opps. However many try to do photo shoots here and it can be difficult when you get in the way of their shoot. There's nothing they can do about it since it is a public place.
author: Crystal Grace G.

description:
I wanted to check these stairs out for their beautiful, intricate tiles. It's hard to find parking because it is located within a neighborhood. Go in the late afternoon. There were a lot of people gathered at the bottom of the steps because it is a pokemon go stop. Everyone was on their phones. 

The steps show a great view of San Francisco. Check the weather before you go so you don't get foggy clouds.
author: Andrea B.

description: What a beautiful art installment with a view to match at the top of the steps! The project was started in 2003 and features 163 steps with tiled mosaic stones. There is street parking around the area where you can park for free. It is windy atop the hill so be prepared. This spot is perfect for pictures (I'm talking to you fashionistas trying to get that streetwear shot for the Gram), a casual hike/walk or a work-out. The mosaic tiles have a Sea to Sky theme. The steps will lead to Grand View park. This place usually isn't on my list of places to take tourists when they come visit me in the bay area but it is definitely something worth visiting if you have more than 1 day to spend in the city.
author: Brenda L.

description: This really is a wonderful display of community art! They say that the tiled steps lead you from the sea to the stars - indeed the summit has one amazing view overlooking SF!
author: Judi B.

description: my favorite place, this is also the place I bring my friends and visitors, it's not a tourist spot but it has beautiful view, especially when you walk up the stairs to the Grand View Park.
author: Choy T.

description:
These are beautiful tiled steps in a quiet neighborhood. Here are some tips to consider:

1. Parking is free on the residential side streets. Parking can be hard to find during peak hours.

2. Walk to the top. The view is amazing and worth the trip up the steps. 

3. Google Maps will take you here without any issues. Easy directions.
author: Sam N.

description:
I love to do stairs,so on my recent trip to San Francisco. I had to find out where is the cool staircase in the neighborhood. I am glad to have found the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps. It is located on Morage St between 15th & 16th Ave. Parking is readily available on the street. It is in a residential neighborhood. Apparantly it is a neighborhood grassroots project to connect neighbors in beautify San Francisco Golden Gate Heights Neighborhood. It has 163 step stairway

 They have created something special and amazing You can see the mosaic are beautifully handcrafted into shapes of animals, fish, shells, stars and sea theme. The hike was easy, pleasant and safe. The tiles are interesting and exceptionally made. It is not meant for a real hike,but rather an experience

I had a great time. It made my SF more enjoyable.
author: Julie P.

description:
A nice place to see or to take visiting friends/family because it's not a super known tourist spot.  

I took some friends here a little while ago on a lovely sunny day and surprisingly enough there weren't any people around.  It was pretty early in the morning, but I still expected quite a few just because it's san francisco.  

I forgot that not a whole lot of people know of the steps though, which is exactly what the appeal is to me!  It's a great example of local art and a great place for scenic views of the whole city and some of the bay area.

If you're the type of person who likes to take picnics, then the top of the steps is definitely the place for you!

It's just a fun little activity, for locals or visitors, to further enjoy our beautiful city!
author: Kevin K.

description: This place is just one of the unique spots that you have to stop by if you visiting the Bay area. Each set of stairs has its own theme: sun, moon, ocean, forest, and animals creating a very beautiful "hiking experience". It can be a crowded touristy spot on the weekends so I would suggest to come early morning or later evening if you want to take that picture for the Grams. If you are fit and want to exercise, just keep walking up through 15th and 14th street to the little park uphill. The "park" is small but has a wonderful rustic feel to it. Wonderful view of the ever colorful San Francisco from the top of the hills. Street parking is plenty on 16th and Moraga St. We made a mistake of turning to 14th and it was a dead end so just fyi if you don't want to walk too much.
author: Vivi L.

description:
For artists to handcraft and paint mosaic tiles that span four or five flights of stairs and have them illustrate a beautiful connection between the sea, land, and heavens, this local attraction is undeniably remarkable. Especially for those who love to scour street art like myself, I won't forget this gem. 

Things to know:
*****
I. LOCATION & PARKING
If you're using Google Maps, the location listed on Yelp should take you to the top of the stairs. So, as I pulled up in my Lyft, I started off by experiencing an incredibly gorgeous panorama of several San Francisco neighborhoods.

Regarding parking, well, there are spots all around.

II. THE STAIRS
As I noted above, they span several flights. So with that being said, be sure to use the railing while you ascend or descend since they're a bit steep. To view the full span of this masterpiece, you'll have to stand about 10-15 feet in front of the base. (Well, if you're using the camera on your phone.) 

I seriously urge you, art lover, you, to take some time and admire each individual step, too. Some may comprise of tropical fishes that seem to acknowledge every hue of the rainbow. Others may be more subdued, but coalesce to form a moon. And if you examine closely, some small groups of mosaic tiles even note the stairs' sponsors. (Fantastic.) 

III. TIME
I took about a solid half-an-hour to check out these steps, and, again, if you love street art and find yourself in San Francisco it's a worth-while trip. I would consider returning, most definitely. 

The top of the stairs also falls only about twenty or thirty feet away from Grandview Park, which has a spectacular 360 view of the city. One of my favorite views of the city, actually.

IV. OVERALL
The stairs definitely help beautify an already fabulous neighborhood. Take some time to appreciate this San Francisco gem.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Our Uber driver couldn't find this since it's tucked away in a residential area. Pouring rain we kept searching till we saw the beautiful mosaic tiled steps.
We went all the way up and admired the foggy and wet sfo view on our way down.
author: AL K.

description: The design and artwork is stunning! Even with the fog and gloomy SF sky, the colored tiled steps really brightens up the area. The 16th Ave Tiled Steps is public, free for everyone to admire, and is located in a residential area. The steps are easily accessible through public transit, driving, or by foot (Google Maps can guide you here without a problem). I came on a Friday around 6pm and there were only a few other people there, so snapping some beautiful pictures without a bunch of people in the background wasn't a problem. I'll definitely be back sometime in the future to admire the artwork again and get in a quick and fun workout from climbing the steps.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps is located in the Sunset District.  I personally don't think that it's a hidden gem any more as the SF Chronicle mentioned it in one of their write ups.

The tiled steps is a collaboration between the neighborhood and SF Parks's trust.  This beautification project greatly enhanced the area and is visited by not only locals, but tourist.  The tiles are articually laid out.  There are approximately 169 steps to get to the top and is an easy workout.

On one of my visits I overheard a neighborhood resident saying that some plants got uprooted and stolen so she was policing the area.  To the person who stole the plants....the park is for us to all enjoy and shame on you for taking away our enjoyment.  Go buy your own plants!
author: Peter C.

description:
Right off the bat, this is such an adorable beautiful place to visit, ironically, since it is only a long stairway located in the quiet neighborhood of The Sunset District. 

However, these stairs are not just any flight of stairs. The stairs consist of such beautiful intricate tiles that make up each step. It's not just a short flight of stairs either, it is quite a long walk up which makes the walk even nicer as you notice each step you take on the beautiful art work. 

I did get a little bummed going here because of course, a lot of people kept blocking or unintentionally photo bombing the photos I was trying to take, however, it is to be expected. 

LOL....atleast there is alot of people to ask if you want a photo of you and your friends or you with a loved one, etc. 

Parking is residential based.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Beautiful mosaic tile steps for unlimited photo ops. A selfie lovers dream! Too bad you can't see most of the tile art if you're only capturing selfies so make sure to bring a friend to take pics of you. Seriously, put your phone/camera down. It's OK to let someone other than yourself take a pic of you. It'll be ok! ;p 

Jokes aside, these steps are so purdy... And the view! Once you get to the top of the mosaic steps. Take your pics and go across the street to climb more steps (these are wooden steps) for an amazing 360 degree view of SF. Try coming during sunset! I'm positive it'll provide beautiful pics. It's called golden hour for a reason :)
author: Grace C.

description: Beautifully decorated steps! Crowded with people taking pics on them. Go up the stairs and check out Grandview Park while you're there.
author: Jessica B.

description: Must see while in the city.  I've been to SF a hundred times and never saw these until recently.  Definitely walk up to the top!  The art work on the stairs is beautiful and the view from the top is breathtaking.
author: Effie B.

description:
This place is amazing. You can see the artwork within the tiles and when you walk all the way up, you get an amazing view of SF. Me and my fiance came first thing in the morning and there weren't people around. That was great for us, because we were able to take as many pictures as we wanted without people getting in the background!

Parking is on the street. Don't be too loud since it is a residential neighborhood. I would imagine that many people like to work on their fitness with these steps! I work out, and I even got a little winded from running all the way up!
author: Michelle S.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said? These are a beautiful set of stairs that bring a pop of color to the area. Note, they can get a bit crowded, but the view is amazing and the fact that all the stairs work together to form a complete set of art to show the seasons is great. 

Note: you can start at the top for an easier set, but you won't see the complete image until you are at the bottom.
author: Crystal S.

description: A hidden gem along the coast of San Francisco! It took me two different times to locate the mosaic stairs, and they are absolutely stunning with a view of the Pacific to match! But don't stop at the top of the stairs, if you take a right at the top and walk about a quarter of a block there is another set of stairs, which are not mosaic that will give you an unbelievably view of the entire city!
author: Keisha K.

description:
I totally forgot to write a review for this place until I saw Peter C. check in..

When I stayed in San Fran at my friend's place. Him and his gf brought me here. The stairs are painted beautifully. Different designs on each section but they connect well together. 

I stopped at one where it was a picture of moon steps. Friends gf had the idea of taking pictures for me at that area.

It was easy to go up and down these steps! If you go up more then there's mini park upper with a swing.

Looking down from the top of these steps is a great view of San Fran. You'll see all the hills.
author: Lora C.

description: It's pretty cool to look at. I waited forever, but never actually got a picture taken without people walking up/down the steps. I guess I should have gone early in the day instead of afternoon.
author: Monica Y.

description:
View at the top is spectacular (but not as good as Grand View Park...so head there right after)! You're bound to get photobombers in your instagram photo-of-the-day, since this is such an iconic spot. 

Beautiful tiles, beautiful plants surrounding it, making the hike up a lot easier! 

PS: Has anyone tried counting how many steps there are? Online says 163...
author: Hurjane V.

description: This is such a nice hidden place in San Francisco. A must go! The view from the top is just incredible & the stairs are so pretty and worth seeing in person. The best part is it's free! I'm not from the area. I was originally wanted to go Coit tower but found this place on yelp. I'm glad I did, It saved me money and the view is just as amazing.
author: Ira S.

description:
The Sixteenth Ave Steps is kind of a workout.  The day we went it kind of cloudy, and chilly (about 52 degrees), but worth the extra effort.  As I was wheezing up the stairs (I have asthma) we turned to see the different vistas as we went higher and higher.  My sister in law told us about these steps located by Morgana & 16th about 1/2 mile south of Golden Gate Park.  So what's the big deal?  The stair perpendicular to the hill slope & are decorated with beautiful mosaic patterns on the risers. As you walk up several flights of stairs you see beautiful intricate mosaic patterns.  The treads & landings have tan tiles with a grey tile about 6"W at the nosing.  When you reach the top about 3-4 flights up, you turn around and see a beautiful panoramic of the city below shrouded w/low flying clouds.

At the top there is another street, to the right there is another short flight of plain unadorned concrete steps that take you up another level and another street.  From that point there are some wooden stairs that zig zag up to the top of the hill.  We were feeling ambitious so we started climbing up the stairs but it was so dam cold and windy with the clouds moving in  we decided to can the climb and come back down.

Something to be aware of, we were told that SF is the smash and grab Capitol of America so it's advised that you put anything of value in the trunk
author: Phil S.

description:
Haikus:

A new place to see:
163 steps
Climb up to the sky.

Moraga Street is
Too steep to drive on this part,
So it's a staircase.

Multicolored tiles
Make pictures on the staircase.
No graffiti yet.

Sunset's only spot
To draw the tourists to enjoy.
No buses allowed.

(step step step step step)
(pant pant pant pant pant pant pant)
(now it's steeper!  NOOOOO!)

Burn your lungs and quads,
Get in shape in the best way
By using these steps.
author: Ron L.

description:
In LOVE with these stairs. 

I don't know why I have never been here! I lived in the area for 8+ and didn't even know about these beauties. Such a bummer, because they are gorgeous and lead up to a great overlook point that I would have frequented if I knew about it!

My friend brought me here when I last visited. It was super easy to get to and street parking was easy enough to find - even on a warm Saturday afternoon. It was a little busy on the stairs and overlook point because it was Fleet week. A little difficult to take good pictures with people all around hogging the stairs, sitting, lingering and photo bombing your every attempt to create artistic looking hipster selfies. So I suggest coming on a weekday during an off time.

Otherwise, the steps themselves are gorgeous. And if you go all the way up, you get an amazing view of the sunset district. I could probably sit there for hours. And I am sure people do, great view and perfect for lovers to canoodle.
author: Natasha S.

description:
What did I do on Mother's day? Climbed the Tiled Steps! lol
Driving through the city and I wanted to check out some of San Francisco's must see's!
I wish we came earlier, but I can't complain because I finally made it. My suggestion is to go early! Majority of people always have the same idea as you, crowded but waited til other tourist made it down the steps so I can take pictures. My daughter went only half way up as I went to the top. Gorgeous view which leaves it priceless!

Happy Mother's day to all!
author: Kathy V.

description:
Great place for a picture. It's right in the middle of a residential neighborhood up on one of the many hills. Quite a few other tourists visit so you may have to wait a bit to get your solo pic without anyone in the shot. 
We visited just as the sun was setting and it was just nice to sit and relax.
author: Mary E.

description:
I've been wanting to go to these steps forever.
I am a HUGE fan of art and what's great about SF is that there are so many hidden gems, and views that you can see. One of the many reasons why SF is so beautiful to me.

Parking is anywhere in the surrounding neighborhoods.

I wish I had gone on a less busier day and time. I came on a Sunday and man, those steps were crowded lol

It was still beautiful though. Although I wanted to take pictures of it and not have anyone else there.

I love the sun & moon part at the top. I plan to climb up them next time in the day! 

Bring a jacket. It does get pretty windy up there.
I did come here at night one time and the view up at top is pretty awesome. I'm such a sucker for city views!!!

SF, I love you.
author: Jasmine N.

description:
Cool if no one is around. There's always groups of tourist here. Sometimes you want to enjoy the steps without the groups of people taking photos. It's a good walk around the area to grab fresh air. 

Easiest way to get here is from 19th ave and moraga, and walk straight up the hill on moraga towards 16th ave. I've met other people trying to find these stairs in the sunset and couldn't find it. They were told its in the sunset, and I bumped into them at Irving and 2nd ave. For people from out of town it is in the sunset, but you're 25 blocks away up hill. From downtown, take the N Judah to  19th Ave and Judah, then the 28 to moraga street and walk.
author: Robin L.

description:
My travel pal, Yuri, was so enthusiastic about climbing these stairs...

"Uhg!", I thought, as I slowly went up, higher and higher...  

I took my time and looked at the patterns of mosaic art.  Wow - so intricate!  It must have taken so much time to create!  

From afar, it looks like a certain design, but then - when you look closer, you can see other smaller details!  Some tiles have sentimental sayings or are embossed with "memories"...  You need to have a look for yourself!

Then - when you reach the top, you are rewarded by a spectacular view!  

Do it!  

It's beautiful, free of charge, with plentiful parking in the neighborhood, and it's so worth it!!!  After that, ascend higher to the Hidden Garden Steps, and upwards to the Grand View Park!!!
author: Nadine C.

description:
I love local land marks and this is a good one as far as free and public art goes. You do have to climb these stairs though to fully appreciate the magnitude of this art piece. I highly recommend starting from the bottom and go up. We got dropped off on the top of the stairs and had to climb down and then back up again (legs were burning). However, it did give us the time to really look at the different patterns in the mosaic and notice all the smaller details! Some of the tiles even have writing on them!

We really had a good time looking at this beautiful mosaic. It must have taken so much time and patience to construct something like this. It was so much fun and we loved how it wasn't all that crowded. This is in a residential area so please be respectful of your surroundings. I hear that car robberies happen pretty frequently due to the high foot traffic so make sure to lock up your cars and take anything important with you. It's cute, free, and beautiful! Worth a visit when you're in the area. 5/5
author: Michelle L.

description:
If there was a place in San Francisco that I had to say one should DEFINITELY go, it would be the 16th Avenue Tiled Steps! We took a Muni bus to them, and even though it seemed like it was a bit of a journey, it was completely worth it.

Not only are the steps and landscape around them absolutely beautiful, but the area also provides some amazing un-obstructed views of the city. Make sure to go all the way to the TOP past the mosaic stairs, across the street, and up another flight of stairs. You can get 360 degree views of San Francisco from there!

The whole walk should only take about 15 to 20 minutes (plus more time to take photos, enjoy the views, etc). Enjoy!
author: Rashmi G.

description: Excellent attraction in the outer sunset neighborhood of west SFO. Gets a bit crowded so you'll have to wait if you want some perfect shots but a neat concept nevertheless!
author: Sudipto G.

description:
My favorite tile: "Eat my shorts" 

If you want to experience shortness of breath and sore ass muscles, I recommend going up and down these steps half a dozen times with short rest breaks.

Also, the view is dope.
author: Duckie A.

description: Fun touristy spot to stop at if you're in the area! Take your Instagram photos while you can... there will be people in the back of your photos no matter what so just take them and move on. Be considerate to others as they should be to you too! The view is beautiful at the top and definitely worth the climb. Parking can be tricky since it's in a residential area but people are coming and going constantly.
author: Ashley C.

description: 163 beautiful tiled steps. I started at the top and worked my way down, so I had to stop every so often to turn back and look at the steps. It would've been better to start at the bottom of this staircase and make your way up. I especially enjoyed the moon and sun sections of the stairs. If you're in SF, then take the time to stop by and take a look.
author: Helen H.

description: I love it! The view is breath taking! Great  view of the city . I would definitely come back to visit.
author: Anie S.

description:
I love this place. It's quiet, it's beauty, it's amazing, it's just the place you need to visit!

I took Lyft here from Alamo Park (about $10.20 of a ride) & he took me to the top of the stairs. It's way better if you start at the top because when you work your way down, you get to see the artwork from each set of stairs you complete. So in a way, you get rewarded for the cardio work of walking down stairs. Plus, you get to see the amazing view from the top. 

Then when you walk to the bottom of the stairs, you get to see all sets of the artwork from the sea to the sun. It's absolutely breathtaking whether it's the artwork or the top view. And it's great cardio work so you obviously don't need a 24 hour fitness pass to accomplish leg day. 

The neighborhood obviously take pride in this place because the stairs are clean and there's a nice garden of plants at the bottom. Don't be too loud though because it is a quiet neighborhood. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Jeanette Y.

description: Absolutely breathtaking views at the top and even more breathtaking artwork on the way up. This place just blew me away. The photo ops here are endless. Parking can be a pain and we parked legally in front of a home on 16th facing the stairs and we're about to get out of our car when the homeowner (some Asian lady) came out and asked us to move, I asked if I parked in a spot I would get ticketed and she said no she had a hard time getting in and out of her garage when people park by it. UHM SO!??! Then move! We were nice about it and got back in our car and found another spot. I hope she doesn't do that to everyone that parks near her garage, it's public parking last I checked.
author: Mary M.

description:
163 steps. Yes, I counted.

This hidden treasure is located in a residential area in San Francisco. It does get crowded here with the workout groups and the tourists so just be prepared to dodge the runners and people taking pics.

If its not too busy, take the time to appreciate each individual tiled step. Its so creative and if you are into art, you will love it.

At the top of the stairs, if its not too foggy, you will catch an amazing view. Definitely worth the climb!

Great workout, great photo op, this is a must see in San Francisco!
author: Liza L.

description: Fun and unique! Bring a friend who will take a bunch of pictures for you! It gets busy tho so plan strategically!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Very nice to see all steps. Artistic steps are only to see this place at San Francisco.
author: Samuel T.

description: So I had no idea about this place. Turns out to be I was driving and there was lot of traffic on 19th. So I decided to turn on morals, well something just happens for good :) it gets very exciting when you find something on your own and with any reference. I was really amazed to see this place. It's so beautiful. Really gorgeous. Definitely a must see.
author: Pritika M.

description: Beautiful steps and the view is even more amazing. Seriously worth the small climb! The artwork on the steps was really intricate and had a well composed design. Check it out!
author: Rupi B.

description: The Tiled Steps are a great spectacle and a must-see when in San Francisco! Each flight of stairs has a different mosaic that is beautiful. It can be slightly difficult to find the steps, but you might stumble upon some cool places. My mom and I parked on 14th Avenue and made our way up a regular flight of stairs. To our surprise we saw a beautiful view of the whole city! We ended up at Grand View Park and it was a GRAND view. Definitely stop by Grand View Park while visiting the steps. The steps can be busy at certain times of the day. We went around 5 on a Saturday and there were about 40 people there. Everyone is trying to get a picture with the steps, so it goes by quickly if you want to get a picture. P.S. make sure to lock your car and don't leave any valuables in your car because there are signs saying car theft is high in the area. Definitely go see these beautiful steps and enjoy the magnificent views of the city!
author: Ismael P.

description:
I don't want to call myself lazy but I saw the steps, I saw they were beautiful, and it never once, not even for a second, occurred to me to walk up them. 

I brought my family here and my Dad asked if I was going to climb them and I think my response was quick and sharp, as if he were the dumb dumb, "Nope. I've climbed a step before. I know what it feels like. I'm good." 

If only I'd known the view I was missing. 

But in my defense, my 70-something year old grandmother was there and it would have been super rude of me to take off without her so yeah, she's my bonafide scapegoat on this one. 

Next time, I'll climb. 
I'll climb and I'll stop on every step to take in the tiles that start at the sea with the colorful little fishes and gain elevation to the swirling sky, topped by the sun and moon. 

The best part is that this destination is totally free to do and located in a beautiful residential neighborhood just far enough away from the main tourist destinations of SF that you can usually get some version of privacy here.
author: Candice G.

description: The stairs are so beautiful! To go up is very easy and not long. The view to the top is very beautiful as well. It does get crowded so pictures are hard to come by. It's a fast trip like 20-30min.
author: Ilse V.

description:
We were beat up by the wind and rain hiking over the hill to get there, but well worth it seeing the urban art. The thousands of colorful tiles creating a beautiful creation spilling down the many steps is really something cool to see. 
Tiles shaped into moon, stars, sun, flowing, cascading stream with green grasses and flora and woodland animals, tiles with names of donors stamped into leaf mosaics, makes you appreciate an eclectic city like SF even more.
author: Danielle G.

description:
Such a fun and nice local landmark.

Street parking. 

The steps are pretty wide but I bet it can get crowded if a lot of people are here.

I say it is dog friendly because my dogs went up and down with no problem. I got lucky because it was not crowded. 

Easy to walk, takes less then 10 minutes. Great views. Love the artsy tile work on the steps. 

Must visit!
author: Kevin W.

description: This is a must do if you are ever in Frisco.  Thanks to my Yelp friend, Ann S. for posting these photos and review.  That's how I find out about this place to begin with.  It's a hidden gem and you just have to find parking in the residential area.  A total photo opp for all of your social media needs.  I absolutely loved the tiled steps!!!  Gorgeous artwork of tiles!!!  It's also a good workout for your legs.  The view is really nice once you get to the top.  I really enjoyed this spot and I hope you will too!
author: Yuka N.

description: Fabulous spot for that perfect city Instagram photo. Plenty of people to help your group get the right shot, but not so many that you have to wait in line for the photo-op. Also, absolutely gorgeous tiles. Very beautifully laid out and executed.
author: Melissa E.

description: We absolutely loved this location. We love how the scene moves from the sea, to the earth, to the blue sky, to the sun. The walk isn't too strenuous, either and it's cool.
author: Jaycee B.

description: Highly recommend to visit. It's beautiful! When you get to the top of the stairs, go right and climb all the way to the top to get a great city view!
author: Ellen C.

description: This is off the beaten path and a great stroll through parts of San Francisco that most people do not get to see. The Uber driver that dropped us off has lived in San Francisco for 30 years and admitted he had never been. The walk up is not as bad as it looks. There are so many pictures posted of the tiled steps but I especially loved the view of the less touristy portion of San Francisco. Furthermore there is a small park just above the steps that is also worth the five ten minutes walk up. From here you will spot a windmill that I have never seen before. Definitely I recommend taking the time to see this laid back less crowded and healthier sight especially if you take time to climb it and take pictures a few times as we did.
author: Queen J.

description:
I've seen a lot of pictures for this place and so I was "inclined" to come here. -ba dum tisss-The designs for these stairs are beautiful! I hate climbing stairs but this was enjoyable. 

A few of the tiles also have names commemorating loved ones and each section of stairs has a slightly different theme. The entire stairway comes together nicely and it isn't common to find a place to  enjoy the climb and the view. At the top you can see a good section of SF and behind you will be a park if you decide to climb that as well. 

A lot of people come here to jog but quite a few people come here to take pictures as well. So you won't feel left out if you do either. The people here are friendly and definitely glad to help if you need any photos taken. Do be aware that because of the traffic on these stairs, there is mud on them at times. Be careful where you sit. 

It is within residential area so you will have to find street parking. Luckily we found a spot literally in front of the bottom of the stairs.
author: Jessica Q.

description:
Been in the bay area most of my life and I never visited this place until now. Holy moly, this is an amazing display of art! Now getting here can be difficult as the roads are narrow, a specialty of San Francisco. There is quite a few parking spaces available but be wary that since this is a tourist spot, you have a increase of car break ins so do not leave any valuables in plain sight. 
Now there is a lot of steps to climb but each step is designed beautifully and there are several designs as you ascend the steps ranging from the ocean, moon and the sun. When you reach the top, if you turn around you are greeted with a bird's eye view of the whole ocean front......assuming it is not foggy. 

But wait there's even more! past the hill is even more steps but you can go to the very top of the hill and either swing by the cliff side or even have a better view of almost a 360 view of San Francisco!
author: Jason H.

description:
Came by the other day and the views at the top was fantastic! 

The tiled steps seems to be unknown to tourists and visitors alike thus making this a hidden gem!

The steps were well maintained and plenty of street parking was available!
author: Derek S.

description:
At last! I was finally able to experience this tourist attraction. Here is what I thought of this place.

Parking
Neighborhood street parking. The roads are pretty tight so be careful. If you can't park at the bottom of the stairs, try the top.

Feels
Beautiful. 10 years old and it's crazy how it still attracts many people. The art itself is beautiful as it takes you from the earth to the moon! Also don't forget to enjoy the view and the plants around it.

Overall
5 stars. Coming here on a Wednesday afternoon, it wasn't too packed. We did get lucky with parking as for the art itself, kudos to the community members for creating this beautiful piece of art. It's inspiring to see what a community can do. I definitely recommend this place to tourists rain or shine.

TL;DR Tips:
* There is a mini park above to get a wonderful view of the city.
* SPOILER-163 steps.
* Think of a pose before you go, this place is busy 24/7
author: Leland S.

description: Tourist spot that is free! Kudos to the people that help put together the mosaic tile. I love how they made use of the space. Garden on the side and tiled steps in the middle. We should have more of these all over the city. Parking was not as bad as I thought it would be. But please be courteous to the residents.
author: Rhina M.

description: If you're craving exercise & beauty, then head up the hills in the Sunset district for lots of cardio and visual eye-candy.  The Tiled Steps are a pleasure to behold and everyone just seemed so happy to be there.   It is a hike, and it is mad touristy.   But amazing views and just really pretty tiled mosaics with landings in between for a rest.
author: Sophia I.

description: A must see!! The view the whole way up is spectacular and the gardens surrounding these stairs are magnificent. The tiles are gorgeous- incredible photo opp. This is a hidden gem in SF and I highly recommend you go!
author: Katherine C.

description: Beautiful! Loved seeing the mosaic steps. So colorful and well constructed patterns. And beautiful succulents alongside.
author: Kristina S.

description: SO gorgeous! Walk up to the small park at the top and see an amazing 360 view of the city. What an incredible moment of delight. The steps are beautiful. Beware of crotchety neighbor who lives next door, but beautifully maintains the garden.
author: Kana L.

description:
How can you not love these amazing stairs!!! If these babies were within a 10 mile radius of my home or work I'd be here at sunrise & sunset 7 days a week.

They are steep, beautiful on the eyes with an artistic touch and names inscribed for a personal touch. They also offer a breath taking view of San Francisco.

Head to the top...the payoff is worth it

Thank me later,
~Christy loves you SF
author: Christy A.

description:
Hotspots like the 16th Ave Tiled Steps make me wonder why other locations like Lombard Street and the Painted Lady's get so much hype. If you're the kind of person who gets inspired by breathtaking views, then I highly encourage you to check out the steps on Moraga. It's very accessible from anywhere in SF, it's SUPER quiet, and the view is drop dead GORGEOUS.

You won't have to fight for parking unlike other tourist hotspots. The Tiled Steps are located in a quiet neighborhood that seems like it's made for rich people. But anyway, the location is very quiet and gives off the appearance that you are in some other world, far away from the city.

The steps don't actually go very far up, but I implore you to try to see the difference in view as you walk up to the top. Unfortunately there's a big tree at the end, but if you climb up to the second-third to last platform, you will get a raw view of San Francisco residential areas. It kinda beats seeing all the hustle and bustle of the financial district amirite?

All in all, this place is a nice break from reality when you are busy with your life. Bring your friends, bring your partner, bring your lover and have a blast while checking out the nice view.

Have fun and prosper!
author: Bryan W.

description: Stunning tiled steps and amazing views, all for the low price of free - not too bad!
