I wonder if the colors would've popped more at a different time of day. I'm sure I'm going to try to test this theory now that I've actually been to this gem and found it to be worth it!

Make sure you check out Grand View Park (see my review) once you make it to the top of the mosaic steps. Yes, there are a lot more stairs involved, but it's well worth it, especially if you're there on a clear day. If you think the view is pretty at the top of these tiled steps, just wait until you make it to the top of Grand View Park! Absolutely breathtaking (pun intended).
author: Allison B.

description: Nice little park, and cool steps if you walk here.  We drove from our hotel earlier today and had 3 of our rental car windows busted, and 3 suitcases stolen.  Cops found 1 and brought it before we left.  We found our car this way at about 3PM, we were there maybe an hour.
author: Jaymey J.

description: This is a must stop in the city on the way up to Grand View Park. Be sure to start your journey here and go all the way to the top of the hill for an amazing view.
author: Arthur K.

description:
It's beautiful, don't get me wrong. But all the people crowding it makes it less beautiful. 

Story time: My friend and I started our walk at the bottom of the stairs. We wanted to take a quick shot of the stairs, but there was a girl having a full on photoshoot with two saps (her friends: one holding her bag and one taking her pictures), so we decided to go to the top first. We went up to Grandview Park and had a long chat (I don't know how long, just trust me when I say it was long). When we came back, the same girl was still taking a bunch of pictures. She laid across the stairs and everything. It was like she owned it (or tried to) I'm all for camwhoring, I guess, but be a little considerate, take a break, let others have a turn. We left, and the girl was still having her "photoshoot."

I had a negative memory from this place, but I hope others did/do not.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Hands down my favorite place I went to while visiting SF!

Nature + hike + ocean and city views + unique stairs

I went at sunset, which was spectacular. 360 views at the top. Don't stop when the tiled steps end - go all the way to the top of the hill. You will not regret it! 

Total time up: ~10-15 minutes. Not too crowded.
author: Marcia N.

description: Its on a steep hill. You can come take that typical instagram picture. It's located in a neighborhood so be courtesy to the people living in the area. Street parking only.
author: Allan W.

description:
So, so beautiful! I guess this is the spot to take your engagement/wedding photos, because there were several groups doing just that. I'd suggest going on a weekday or avoid weekend afternoons. Otherwise, it is difficult to take pictures without others unintentionally photo bombing. A couple was full on kissing in the background in our pictures... haha.

Is it sad that my legs were a bit sore the day after visiting these steps? On a warm, sunny, cloudless SF day, it would be nice to go all the way up these steps to the wooden steps. I bet the view is breathtaking, though I wouldn't know, because I visited on a typical foggy SF afternoon.
author: Mindy D.

description: Awesome. Love the detail of the mosaic on every step, from the cute frogs to the colorful fish. Up close and individually, there is so much beauty in each piece, but as a whole, I also love how it comes together to form such a beautiful and cohesive mosaic. Functional urban art at its finest. Also love that it's a good workout. The view gets better and better with each set of stairs, albeit more windy. Climb up the mosaic stairs, then wind up a ways in the residential neighborhood to take more wooden stairs. Then, you can see the view of the bay. You can see past Land's End, as well as the entire Golden Gate Park, and then some.
author: Phoebe C.

description:
This is a gorgeous community project in SF that has become a tourist attraction that one sees in pictures of SF but isn't quite sure what it is. This is it.

I believe there's 164 steps to the top, each step combines to make beautiful pictures from afar but if you look closely at each one, they're unique. I saw dedications to loved ones, congratulations, pictures of animals, tv quotes, and pretty much anything else.

Go up at least halfway, there's a nice view of the city to be seen, enjoy :)
author: Emily G.

description: The stairs still there, if you didnt see it, it is the other way around of the park :) Have fun and enjoy the work of art in SF
author: Avi W.

description: I definitely got my work out on walking up these steps, but you don't really notice the climb because you have the amazing images to distract you. My husband and I read that you could see the Golden Gate Bridge once you reached the top, but after we reached the top, there was no bridge to be seen. Maybe we walked in the wrong direction? There were cute gardens on either side of the steps as well. I should have read the history behind this project before I arrived to really appreciate these steps. It's good to visit these steps at least once during your trip to San Francisco for the experience.
author: Adilia S.

description: I was on a solo trip and went to see this early on a Friday morning... And I'm SO glad I did! There were only 3 other people there so the time was ideal and I was able to soak it all in my own world.  I recommend climbing the stairs and then continuing on up the hill. Look to your right at the top of the stairs and you'll see another set of wooden stairs which leads to the very top of the hill- killer view!!!! I felt like I was on top of the Earth. Loved it!! Must see for a perfect, pano city view.
author: Lisa P.

description: Nice tiled steps. Tourist spot for a nice picture.
author: Anh T.

description:
Nice looking steps, but a tourist destination?

This would've been something nice to see if not for all the people walking up and down. All I saw was a bunch of legs walking up and down blocking the majority of the steps. The mosaic tiles do look nice but it was impossible to see the entire artwork. I gave up after 10 minutes and couldn't even take 1 photo without another human being in it.

Probably would've been a better experience if I had visited earlier in the day. I wouldn't call it a tourist destination though. It's probably more in line with something to see in San Fran if you have extra time but skip it if you don't. You're not missing much and the photos on Yelp would suffice.
author: Tim L.

description:
Great art and has great prespective whether near or far. The public art is a staple of what makes San Francisco one of the cities people admire and this is one of the best in the city. 

After you finish climbing the stairs continue to Grand View Park to have a relaxing view of the city, Golden Gate Park, and Ocean Beach!
author: Jason H.

description: BEAUTIFULLLLL (and windy bring a jacket and comfortable shoes there's a park all the way up)
author: Davina B.

description: A great and mostly foggy view of the outersunset. Steps are a real delight. Try to visit at off hours when the place is not littered w tour busses or ppl. This is a great stony date idea :-)
author: Chelsey G.

description: Not only is this a well-executed piece of interesting art but the location is awesome with beautiful city views and if it gets people to exercise, that's just a bonus. It's more touristy than I would've expected so be prepared to wait for the steps to clear before getting your photo!
author: Olga G.

description: Cool set of stairs to climb up to an amazing view! I particularly enjoyed reading the tiles on the steps on the way up with dedications to friends, family, etc. from everyone who helped with this project. Definitely a nice hidden find tucked away in the Inner Sunset District.
author: Kim D.

description:
So, I fall into the line of Asians w/the semi-pancake (emphasis on semi) butt syndrome.  
Not all of us have it, cuz I have a few close Asian friends who got dat as5 you could rest a shot glass on. 
(I'll give you a moment)
... .. . ... .. . . ...
.... . .. .
. ... .... ..
(I know.)

Needless to say most of my junk's in the front while I lack in the back, but fortunately for me I eat a ton of bad shit that some of it gets stored in the stock room that is my derriere.  

Nevertheless, I decided to go against what my genes (and jeans) predestined me and challenge my fate. 

The Assignment: Operation big booty hoe (minus the garden tool, add promiscuity)
((j/k, HI DAD))

The Workout :  The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps 

The Scene:  Beautiful tiled steps, a clear and close view of the Golden Gate Bridge (on a nice day) and views of the Outer Sunset and Ocean Beach.

The Undertaking: 163 steps up, 163 steps down.  You must take these steps down in order to get back to your origin.  Or you can make like a roly-poly and roll down (which I wouldn't advise unless you are in fact, a roly-poly) Or, you can fly down. (if you have that superpower, of course.  And if you do, why.are.you.climbing.these.stairs)

The Profanity:  In the hundreds

The Outcome:  Too soon to tell.  I would imagine it'd take a buttload (rimshot) of sets to see any sign of posterior gain/change.

Would I recommend:  YES.  


*If for any reason my review inspired you to thicken your milkshake and in turn successfully brought all the boys to your yard, please private message me and direct me to your yard.
**You could at least share
***I mean really. /rolls eyes   (Again...kidding, Dad!)
****otnay iddingkay, essagemay emay o_0
author: Rho T.

description: Take a moment to come enjoy the colors, designs and view.  I really appreciated the time and thought that went into designing this jem.  Try to go on a day when Karl {the fog} is on a hiatus.
author: Melly G.

description:
This place is absolutely breath taking. Since this was right in front of the bus stop, it was easy to access and to get to by muni. Each of the steps are pieced together by bits of tiles. Walk up the steps and to the top you will get a wonderful view of the city.
When i went, it was a bit chilly. bring a jacket as it can be a bit windy up there, especially when it is cloudy. In estimation it took about 5 minutes to get up to the top.
author: Bei T.

description:
This is an amazing hidden gem by Grand View Park. Bring a picnic, and couple this with a walk up to the top of the park for amazing views of the entire city and a wonderful afternoon. 

I like to take friends visiting from out of town here as a little off-the-beaten-path local experience. It's a bit hard to find, and make sure to locate the bottom of the stairs first. The steps actually look totally ordinary when you walk down them, but they're utterly amazing to walk up with all the mosaic tiles. 

I had trouble finding the bottom of the steps while driving, so we walked from Grand View Park, found the top of the steps and walked down. I told my friend to make sure not to look behind her, so she could get the full experience from the bottom. When we got to the bottom, I had her turn around and take it all in. She loved it! Learn from us, and find the bottom first!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
San Francisco is filled with stairs but these are the prettiest by far.  
Tucked into a neighborhood in the sunset, these stairs have a view both at the top and on the way up.  

When it's foggy, you may have a more limited view, but on a nice day you can see the Pacific.  On weekends and clear days the crowds gather but they disperse rather quickly.  People also exercise here and will do multiple rounds up and down.  It's much better than a stair master at the gym where you are staring at a tv or worse what's jiggling in front of you.  Just be patient and there are clear moments on the stairs where you can get your picture.

My favorite sections of the mosaic are the sun and the moon.

There is neighborhood parking at the bottom and top of the stairs.  Just be mindful or your behavior, people do live here.
author: Kristi G.

description: I was driving around the city visiting clients and I had a bright idea that I was actually smarter than my GPS unit. So I decided to cut across the sunset. I stumbled across these steps by accident and let me tell you it was well worth the detour. Amazing Mosaic Art Stair case with Amazing views of the city. The only thing that went wrong is that I was not dressed for the trek up the stairs. I will be back and I will brings friends. If you are a tourist form out of town stay away I am sure you will have a much better time down at Pier 39 LOL.
author: Manny G.

description: Not necessarily a place to hike, but a great place to see the view of SF! Absolutely breathtaking!  I love the Mosaics for it just gives so much more meaning than just a nice spot to take pictures.
author: Iris C.

description:
This is such a great spot here in the neighborhood. The art work is BEAUTIFUL. Those who had a part of creating the mosaic did an amazing job putting such a large piece of art together for the neighborhood. The details are great, and you can't help but be amazed at the big picture.

This gem is I little tucked away, but when found can lead you to a beautiful view (and give you a great workout!) this is one of the easiest ways to get to Grand View Park by walking, where you can have an even clearer view of the city in a panoramic sense. At the top of the tiled Steps you can see Sunset, the ocean and a good part of south San Francisco. Go to the top of Grand View park to see GG park, downtown, etc. 

This is a beautiful spot to be, I'm so happy that a friend showed it to me!

PS bring a jacket, it does get a little chilly at the top of the steps!
author: Kristine T.

description: Thanks Yelp for letting me know about this.  I had a heckuva time finding these with my GPS despite the fact I had just been up and down to Grand View Park only a block away!  It sure is hard to get a tourist-free photo of the stairs - I waited 10 minutes then finally gave up.  Yes, it was a weekend day so I know why so many people were there.  Glad I found these stairs but view-wise, they don't compare with the block away Grand View Park.
author: Tim L.

description: What a fun secret find! I have lived in SF area all my life and did not know about the tiled steps. We thought they were beautiful and the view of the ocean was great. It is a little disquieting all the signs talking about daytime car break-ins and to hide your valuables. I would not want to live on a street with so many negative sign postings.
author: Amy V.

description:
These mosaic steps are such a gem in an already interesting city. Just another reason to love San Francisco.

Because the staircase is located in a residential area, my friend and I took Uber there so we wouldn't have to worry about parking or getting lost.  We went on a foggy and slightly rainy day, so there was no one else there besides us.  Even when not sunny, the colors of the steps are still so vibrant and the view overlooking the city and ocean is just as beautiful.  Simply allow yourself some time to enjoy the artistic talent that went behind this mosaic and the peaceful getaway in a very busy city.
author: Lauren C.

description: Went there on a very foggy morning. It was worth attending. Went up and down the stairs. Only wish I can see everything but again was foggy. Beware. It can be very tiring. Love the area. Easy to get to depending where in the city you are coming from.
author: C G.

description:
Awesome 360 degrees views and especially of sunset and night scape.  Golden Gate Bridge was not too visible though.

Good idea to bring extra cloth and flashlight.

Would have been nice to have a tripod to get some nice panorama photos.  Perhaps a super zoom lens to capture far away sites. 

Will return better prepared next time.
author: Troy M.

description: Quite nice actually- we've lived here a long time and didn't even know this was here. The "steps" are worth a visit if you have friends in town visiting and you want to show them some local flavor...
author: Art C.

description:
Amazing. Nothing else I can add that hasn't been said, but definitely recommend a sunset viewing. 

There are also another set of steps on 16th and Kirkham, which were just completed on December 7, 2013. Equally awesome and hardly anyone on them. Plus you can follow them up to the Moraga steps - you'll be at the top of these stairs where you'll have a lovely view. You can go down to see the mosaics, or go up to Grand View first, then head back down the Moraga steps. However you do it, fantastic views and wonderful art.
author: Cait E.

description:
This is in a random neighborhood, so if you're close by its great to stop by and snap a photo on the stairs like the majority of people do. Each set of stairs has a different design but my favorite were the sun and moon which are the top 2 sets. It's so beautiful to look at the mosaic design and how intricate the designs are. It's a hidden gem  and shows how eclectic the city of San Francisco is. 

From the top you get a glimpse of the city and the side of the Golden Gate Bridge . When you get to the top there is a small area where you can stroll around. 

I'm a person who loves photography, so it was loads of fun capturing photos of the stairs. But if you want a picture on it without people in the background  it gets a little difficult because this is another tourist hot spot.
author: Sarah L.

description: Such an awesome day today this was our last stop before heading out and I'll tell you the steps as the sun was setting was absolutely amazing such a great experience and definitely think if your in the area it's a great thing to visit for any age and anytime I could look at those forever! So cool how families got to put Names in some of the tiles!
author: Jake C.

description: One of the most beautiful place to see in San Francisco. It's a great place to get some exercise and photo opts!
author: Angie N.

description: Visited the tiled steps on a warm sunny Saturday afternoon.  We drove right up the front and found parking easily.  We walked to the steps and loved the tiled artwork as we climbed to the top.  The tiles were very detailed and colorful and made beautiful pictures.  There's also pretty plants/flowers that are to the left and right of the tiled steps creating a peacful atmosphere.  Once you reach the top, there's a beautiful view of the city.  Surprisingly this place isn't as crowded as I thought it was going to be.
author: Christine D.

description: Why did it take 43yrs for me to go here? A major Tourist attraction but today it was kinda mellow. Stairs are beautifully tile and a bit steep. Luckily there's railings. Once you get to the top, walk across the street to 2nd set I stairs which leads you to the top of the hill. What a site. Panoramic 360*!!!
author: Cee B.

description:
Pretty!! So cool. So creative. Definitely a must visit.
It was hard to get a picture with no one there. Probably just need to go at the right time.

I wish there was more things to do around there though.
author: Jo L.

description: amazing place. I only found out about this place a couple months ago and I just had to go there. it is truly a hidden gem of sf. love this place.
author: Antoine M.

description:
The Mosaic Stairs are beautiful. It's quite a long flight of stairs to the top but it's worth the climb to see the amazing view of the beach. once you get to the top, you'll see another flight of stairs up a hill that will give you a great almost 360 view of the city and the peak of the golden gate bridge. A Must See!

Do a drive by to see if there is parking near there or if you want a small hike with a snack after then park below 19th in the residential areas and walk up Noriega St.
author: Michael S.

description: Easy to find parking and a real gem of the city.  The artist has adorned the steps with colorful tiles that show the Bay's diversity with different sea creatures and swirls of the bay.  I have been here more than a handful of times and it has never been too crowded.  Becoming more of a tourist spot, but worth taking a look!
author: Christina K.

description:
Hm.

Am I missing something?  Yes, it is a unique and very beautiful creation.

But...  they're decorated steps.  In the middle of a neighborhood.  I'm sure it took an incredible amount of effort as well as artistic talent.  But it was honestly pretty anti-climactic.  Especially if you're making the effort to get here by public transit.  You will have to walk a ways, too.  Then you get to the steps, and what do you do?  Take pictures, admire it,  then... walk up?  Not much point except to see the detail of the mosaic.  And plus you don't want to think you came all that way to look at it for a few minutes then leave!

If you're visiting the city, this is not a must-see in my humble opinion.  You'd be  better off going to the Sutro Baths, Lands End, walking the Golden Gate bridge, exploring Golden Gate Park.  Or going indoors to the Exploratorium, the Academy of Science, SF MOMA, or of course, checking out Alcatraz.  However, if you do have extra time and the transportation.. go for it.  At least you have some delicious places to eat back in the Sunset District.
author: Nimai W.

description: With a few hours to kill before my flight from SFO I asked my friend what last things we could do while in his neighborhood in San Francisco. We went to check out the tiled steps. They are kind of hidden away, so you might not notice them at first just passing by. Make sure to take pictures of the individual steps as well as the whole staircase from afar to get the full view. When you get to the top, take the extra time and a few extra steps to reach Grand View Park at the top, it's definitely worth it. San Francisco is an expensive city, so check this place out because it's free and fun for the whole family.
author: Matt P.

description: Beautiful art work! A bit crowded so you might not be able to get a photo of the steps without people in it. Worth the climb to the top and worth it to keep going up the additional steps to grand view park. 360 views of the bay and the city and golden gate bridge in the distance.
author: Caroline K.

description:
A beautifully put together mosaic, a highlight of the neighborhood the staircase is both long and beautiful piece of art atop a windy hill. 

Even after the staircase, there is another hill leading to a two staircase series that leads you to the peak of the hill where a great view can be seen. 

A great sight, the mosaic staircase is a must go-to place if one is visiting SF.
author: Kevin L.

description: You will gasp your way to the top, but boy is it worth it. Visually pleasing, pretty, artsy, a sense of community - all of the above. Such a great way to beautify a neighborhood. Yes, the stairs are pretty, but the view - SPECTACULAR. I chatted up a woman who works out there regularly to ask about the view. She informed me that after you make your way up the mosaic steps, there are even more steps that take you to an even better view. She reminded me to take my time, enjoy, relax - essentially, to take it all in. Sound advice. I did as instructed & stayed for 45mins to take it all in. Such a special spot. Do yourself a favor & go.
author: Elena F.

description: These beautiful mosaic tiled steps are at 16th and Moraga is a must see at least once! There's 163 steps and at the top you have a beautiful view of the sunset and ocean. Great place to watch the sun set on clear days. My family and I love to take walks here.
author: Stacey L.

description: These steps are absolutely stunning. 163 steps of beautiful art. Make sure to get a close look on the step. A lot of the tiles are dedicated to people and families. Each flight is the start of a new design. When you reach the top. Turn around and look behind you. It's a beautiful view right? Want a better one? To the right of the landing is another concrete staircase. Follow it up. You will see a big tree on the top of a hill and a wooden staircase next to it. If you still have the energy. Take those stairs on up. At the top is a tremendous panoramic view of the city. You can even see the oven from up there. You might even find a Pokemon up there. Careful about parking in the neighborhood though. There are signs of day time car break ins posted. Lock your doors and take your belongings with you because you will want to be there for a while to enjoy the view. If the ground was flatter it would be the perfect place to have a picnic. Hell bring your own chairs and just lounge away. There is nothing like it that I have come across yet.
author: Krista P.

description:
With a city as gorgeous as San Francisco, there is always a point where scenic views and epic sunsets/sunrises converge. 

Ok, so we have Twin Peaks. Big whoop.

Up these stairs and up a couple more lies the most gorgeous 360 view of San Francisco. It's a mix of public art, architectural art, and nature. If you no longer live in the city, a tidal wave of nostalgia will hit you like no other, and the slowly setting (or rising) sun only amplifies these pansy emotions. Because really, who likes to cry? Not I!

In truth, this spot exemplifies everything I love about the city. The rolling fog, the random bursts of wind, each individual district in the city, how small this 7x7 city really is... It's where high school students shoot bottle rockets, where awkward couples come for their first kiss, and where friends come to gossip over a couple bottles of PBR. It's home in a nutshell.

San Franciscan native or not, you can only fall in love with both this spot and this city second by second up these steps.

...Maybe not while you're walking up, though. But don't worry, keep going! :)
author: Colleen M.

description:
This's a hidden gem in San fran. The time and effort it took to make this was truly time consuming but definitely worth all of the hard work. thanks to yelp, or else I wouldn't have been able to admire such great art.

The boyfriend and I made a stop here to admire such an amazing hidden gem that SF had to offer. We really liked this! What we disliked is the people who were there while we were there. They couldn't make up their mind if they wanted to climb the thing. So they stood around talking about it. some were on the steps and some were on the bottle just talking while we're trying to wait patiently. We really wanted to take pictures with no one in the background. That took a lifetime because they decided to take pictures and just random folks going up and down. 

The steps were well maintained and the location was pretty easy to find if you're not a local. I just google mapped the address placed on yelp.

My boyfriend and I walked these steps and lets just say I needed a break. I was pretty tired. We tried counting the steps but then lost count half way through. I would say it was around 190 steps. Going down was much easier but a tad scary. Going down the steps isn't as neat as going up because you can't see the art work. At the top of the stairway you'll be able to admire how beautiful san francisco is. 

free parking because you're parking in residential. i would recommend going here if you're visiting sf. it wouldn't take anymore than 30 minutes given the situation we were in [waiting around].
author: Lisa D.

description: Nice place to check in, explore in sf. windy although, the house owner near the stairs grow tons of succulents.
author: Jianfei H.

description: The steps are absolutely beautiful, and so is the view once you get to the top.  I took my time and managed to climb them all.  The people my friend and I met were polite and friendly -- the weather was beautiful and people were in a good mood.  There was even a girl taking pictures of shoes with interesting backdrops, for a class photography project. I did not know this until my friend took me there, but there is another (smaller) set of beautiful steps very near called the Hidden Garden Steps.  http://hiddengardensteps.org/
author: Lira K.

description: Great place to take your friends/family to hangout and get some cool pictures. At the top of the stairs you get a great view of SF. If you drive around the area you can easily find street parking. This place has a lot of foot traffic, so you sometimes have to wait to get a good photo with no one in the background.
author: Alex C.

description: I love that these Mosaic Steps on Moraga is a lesser known tourist attraction in SF. No matter how many people are here, the atmosphere still remains peaceful somehow. There is plenty of parking either at the bottom or top of the steps. I have seen many tourists come just to take photos and leave, but you MUST hike to the top of the steps and beyond. The view at the top of the hill is breathtaking when the San Francisco sky is cloudless. You can see all seven miles across the city, which is a great way to convince any visitor (or local) to check it out.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
BEWARE

We went yesterday at around 5 pm.After only 45 minutes of climbing up the stairs,our car was broken into.Our friend's bag was stolen and the glass was completly shattered.About 5 other cars were also broken into at the same street.Please,if you would like to come here,hide all valueables in the trunk,if its covered,they know something is there.

Other than that,the place was beautiful.After the tiled stairs,theres another staircase that leads to an even better view.
author: Reina D.

description: Really cool mosaic steps.  Walk up to the top and head up to Grandview Park to your right.  Lots of people here so if you want photos without people, stop by early.
author: Linda L.

description:
This area is very neat. There are colorful plants on either side of the steps and the surrounding area is quiet and clean. Once you get to the top of the tiled steps. You can continue walking up a small hill to get a good vantage point of the city. 

At the top of the hill, you will be able to get a bird's-eye view of many of the iconic landmarks/ neighborhoods -Golden Gate Bridge, Golden Gate Park, Twin Peaks, Richmond District, Sausalito, houses neatly arranged in rows, the Pacific Ocean.

The entire walk up the tiled steps and hill took less than 20 minutes. It is well worth it. Take a walk around the surrounding neighborhood after - the houses are beautifully made, each with a unique character. The whole experience was very calming.
author: Rongs L.

description: Visited this site several years ago and IT STILL is in my memory as one of the most breathtaking art pieces in our world.... Yes, world.
author: Linda B.

description: It's a beautiful piece of art.  It is great to see all the steps when you are down of it. You can see the whole image that is in there. Good to take pictures and if you keep walking and climbing the steps you will see a park where you can see the city of San Francisco.  It's great.
author: María M.

description: My boyfriend and I had nothing to do one night in SF and I wanted to see a little view. I decided on visiting here. It was dark so we couldn't admire the steps fully like we could in broad daylight but it was still a fun sight. Definitely need to start working out since I was definitely out of breath halfway to the top.
author: Madison S.

description: Agreeing with everyone else, these steps are beautiful and a must see. The view is great and I love the park at the top as well.
author: Winnie T.

description:
I needed a me day to take a break from the work routine and city life without leaving the city. Had read a lot about this place and figured it was about time I take a look for myself.  Took the N train to 16th Avenue, and was really surprised at how pretty the steps were.  It's a rather grueling hike to the top, but promise yourself to get to the top and you'll thank yourself.  The views are majestic!  

Perfect place to remind yourself of the simplicity of life and be proud you live in SF
author: Lea F.

description:
Lovely tiled steps. Great vistas. One of the best places on the Sunset to catch a view of the neighborhood's namesake. The busiest times seem to be around 2-5pm. After nightfall it has cleared out. Landscaping is still in progress, but the neighbors have planted and maintained a nice variety of succulents.

These steps have become a new tourist attraction on the scale of Lombard Street (almost), with the associated traffic and parking hunters, and people oblivious to road traffic. 

One day I will place a community tripod for all the unprepared selfie takers.

I regret not purchasing a named tile on this delightful destination.

Don't be a jerk, and please take your trash with you. Observe traffic laws. Be respectful of those on or around the stairs.
author: E. W.

description: The steps are beautiful and a great way to exercise your legs. When you are done with the steps, go to the top of the hill, there is a Grand View Park, you will get a good view of the city.
author: Mike G.

description: I literally live on the same block as these stairs. I remember attending the grand opening back when I was in high school, and it never gets old after all these years. Beautiful.
author: Nei N.

description:
Been living in the bay for 6 years now and hadn't heard of these till it showed up in one of these " 15 unknown attractions" list.

Getting to it is easy, just type Moraga St. In the GPS. Parking is mostly easy and plentiful, on a weekday at least.

It's at the end of Moraga St. in SF. It was done as a community project which is becoming more of a tourist attraction, especially with the grand view park above it.

It's a good 300 step walk up with mosaic lined steps forming pictures all the way up, allowing for some great photo ops ( look for the moon). Each step, from the bottom at least, looks to have been sponsored or made by one of the local families.

We went on a Thursday and there wasn't much of a crowd; a couple of student photographers, a lady walking her poodle, an author getting a magazine photo shoot done, and other random, scattered people.

On the sides they've planted mostly water sparing vegetation which was a thoughtful idea.  And from the top you get a great view down to the sea.

A wonderful, beautiful, free attraction.
author: Pantera W.

description: I LOVE these steps. I just could not get enough of how beautiful and creative they were.  We actually found out about these steps from a yahoo article about the most decorative steps around the world.  Lucky for us, these steps were in San Francisco!  The stairs are a relatively easy hike. The views are great from the top.  It can be very chilly and foggy so make sure to bring a jacket.  The stairs are located in a residential neighborhood so parking is pretty easy to find.
author: Janet E.

description: I really suggest parking at the top of the  steps so you can walk down, and see the stairs bit by bit. Then you get the full impact of the artwork when you reach the bottom.
author: Julia D.

description: Omg the tiles were beautiful! I came here after getting lunch and boba. The bench at the bottom was beautifully painted by two community members. The stair tiles has all the names/groups invovled in making it. The walk up wasn't that bad at all. You would never know the tiled steps walking down! You can get a nice view of the street in front all the way down to Golden Gate Park. The higher you go the tree branches start to get in the way but eh still worth the trip.
author: Corie L.

description: Uhm, stairs? YES! Workout with a view. Haha. The top view is beautiful! Who wouldn't love to go up & down these stairs? Good for the butt & great for your eyes.
author: Arni D.

description: Gorgeous art hidden in a more suburban part of San Francisco. The steps themselves make up about 6 flights and each flight has mosaic tiles on the inside portion of the step. When looking up, you see a long art installation that spans all the steps. This is such a lovely addition to what could have been just boring steps connecting neighborhoods.
author: Joanna V.

description:
What a lovely gem in San Francisco! One of the many reasons why San Francisco is such a great place to live. There are all of these random, artistic, unique spots throughout the city, and it never gets old.

I mean, there's really not much to do there. You literally show up, see the tiled steps and that's about it. It looks like some people work out there and run up and down the steps, but what I loved the most is when you get to the very top and keep going.

Just go up the stairs, and then you'll see a hill right across the street. If you go up to the hill, you'll see one of the coolest views of San Francisco - personally, I found it better than Twin Peaks. You see all the way from the ocean to the bay bridge and all that's in between. I've never seen that view of Golden Gate Park and just how massive it is. Highly recommend coming here, even if you're a local.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I first found out about this place when I used to work for the City, and one of my projects had some roadwork at the top of this staircase. The view from it was so amazing that I ended up walking along the staircase instead of paying attention to what the contractor was doing. Sorry for wasting your tax dollars, but hey you can't really blame me.

This is one of the places I recommend to friends from out of town if they want to see some local sights without the hordes of tourists. There will be a few other people here taking selfies and whatnot but it's still a pretty peaceful. Most of them will be at the bottom, where you can see the entire mosaic. So even without doing any climbing, you still have something great to look at! Most of the time you'll see a bunch of fog from the top, which still looks pretty cool, but on the rare occasion when there is sunlight in the Sunset, the view becomes even more awesome.
author: Allen C.

description: Amazing artistic tiled steps in themes and engraved names with a view of SF when you reach the very top - Definitely worth seeing!!  Great touristy place to see that's free and if you're an art fart.  I loved it!
author: Sue N.

description:
Step 1: Before you begin, take in the beautiful mosaic tilework of swirls and celestial bodies. 

Step 2: Get your phone out, go on youtube and play Eye of the Tiger. Just do it.

Step 3: Walk or run up the flight of stairs. Your choice.

Step 4: Catch your breath and take in the view. You're not done yet.

Step 5: Walk down the street to your right and you will find another set of stairs. Walk up them. There's quite a few memorial benches that are kinda creepy, but don't let that stop you.

Step 6: Take a breather, enjoy the panoramic view of gorgeous San Francisco, and yell out peee-niiiis! (500 days of summer reference)

Fin.
author: May D.

description:
This is a nice attraction.  It fits into the general SF tradition of taking a piece of functioning infrastructure, in this case a steep stair case that accesses small public park with grand vistas, and making it decorative and whimsical.

The park at the top is indeed small, but has some great panoramic views of the city.

The staircase is an attraction by itself, although you could easily pass by it several times without noticing it.

You need to be at least functionally ambulatory to get to the top, but otherwise a trip here can be accomplished in the hour or so it might take you to get a table at San Tung.
author: Gopal R.

description:
This is my favorite spot in San Francisco.  I've lived in the bay for almost 10 years and I just went up for the first time in February and it just blew my mind!

First of all, the steps are just gorgeous.  Even if it's a foggy day, at least you can admire the steps when you can't admire the view!

The stairs really aren't that bad although I do recommend comfortable shoes.  

I think because I went in February, there wasn't a lot of people even though it was past noon on a Saturday.  When I went, there were a few old ladies slowly walking up the steps, and like 3 other small groups.

What makes this place even better besides the beautiful mosaic tiled steps is the view you get once you go all the way up to Grand View Park!  I have to agree with another Yelper, the view is even better than what you get at Twin Peaks because it is truly a 360 view of San Francisco, with Golden Gate Park, the Pacific Ocean, a glimpse of Golden Gate Bridge, the downtown skyline, and everything else in between (and by that, I mean the other parts of SF that I seem to always pass through but have never had the opportunity to explore lol).
author: Alyssa S.

description: Really cool place to stop by if your in the area. If you went to Grand View Park, definitely come check this out. It's only a couple blocks away!
author: Brian A.

description:
Although I love going to the gym and my workout classes, I sometimes forget that this amazing workout is literally in my backyard. Just a few blocks away from my house are these beautiful steps. At the top of them, you will find yourself a beautiful view of the ocean. For an extra bonus, keep running up the not so pretty stairs to turtle tower where you will find a view to the entire city. 

Added plus, my friends names are on one of the tiles and it always puts a smile on my face to see their names and other local restaurants/ cafés that donated to this cause.
author: Anastasia N.

description: Beautiful. I have to hand it to the artists who created this. I'm sure a lot of work was spent planning. The borders of the the ocean waves, forest, sun, moon, etc line up perfectly despite the fact that the entire mosaic is fragmented by the stairs. I also love the gardens on sides. The succulents are beautiful. Great view of the city near the top.
author: Cind Y.

description:
Beautiful tiles & views from the top sections!!!
Gorgeous succulents too!
author: E L.

description: Such a cool place to see in the city.  Plenty of parking and its all free so you really cant beat that.  The stairs are beautiful and very colorful.  At the top you get a nice view of the city.  If you continue up to the right you can follow the steps up a little bit further you get to grand view park.  There you get 360 degree view of san Francisco.  You can even see the golden gate bridge if its not too foggy.  Only downside is that there isn't much to do around this area that I saw, seems mostly residential, but a great place to see views of the city!
author: Kate F.

description:
Beautiful!  These steps were decorated in 2005 and have been very well kept.  Very clean and vibrant colors!  The area around the stairs is well maintained as well with nice plants and flowers.

When looking at the stairs remember to take a look back at the beautiful view of SF bay as well!

We walked up the stairs and across the street to Grand View Park which goes even higher!
author: Esther S.

description:
This is as good as it gets! Beautiful mosaic steps that leads up to Turtle Hill. Panoramic views almost as good as Twin Peaks. When the weather is nice and its a weekend, be wary that there will be a lot of visitors there.

Tip: After the Mosaic stairs, if you go to the left and up the street a little, you'll find another staircase that will bring you up to Turtle Hill
author: Rich L.

description: I have been traveling to San Francisco for many years. This time I decided to do a "stair tour" of the city.  By far this was my favorite set of stairs in the city!  The artwork was exceptional and the views at the top were worth every step.  The best part is that it wasn't too crowded for tourist location standards.  TIP: There are no bathrooms!  I wanted to enjoy a lunch at the top but unfortunately I had to to come back down for a restroom...bummer!
author: michelle m.

description: Been a San Franciscan for over 20 years, first time at Moraga stairs beautiful must see.
author: Curt N.

description:
Who needs the gym, when you have these stunning steps to walk up?

Bring an extra layer and take your time ascending up to one of the most spectacular views of the city.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Perfect place for a Bay Area local who wants to see a gorgeous SF hidden gem! Definitely a great place to enjoy beautiful mosaic steps and breathtaking views without the hectic/crazyness of tourist crowds. Went on Sarurday foggy afternoon, but it still did not take away from the amazing experience. Not too many people & easy street parking! Great place to see the next time you find yourself in the city.
author: Mia A.

description: I run these stairs once in a while (more like once in a blue moon), and sometimes I feel like my legs will give out when I'm up to the moon tiled section (second flight from the top). You don't have a panoramic view of the city from the top, but you do have a beautiful stretch of the Outer Sunset and the ocean. You have stunning views going up and going down these steps... so what's not to love?
author: Priscilla W.

description: Wow.Just wow, its amazing hiding gem to see in SF.
author: Dorota S.

description:
Discovered this gem when roaming around SF last week. SF in general has many hidden spots and that's why I keep returning back here. The walk up the stairs is worth it for what you'll see. It does get super cold at the top, even in the summer, so bring a sweater. 
Pretty sight to see and the mural is just incredible.
author: Bup N.

description: Beautiful tiles great if you're into art. Plenty of parking during the week morning-early afternoon. Use the address listed above and parking will be a breeze. One long staircase with the tiles then once you get to the top and turn around you see a great view with the ocean beyond. Love this spot because tourist do not frequent it and it's very peaceful.
author: Gabriella M.

description: Such a good spot to introduce to someone and to discover for yourself. It is so, so, so beautiful and a good walk. You could continue to the top of this area to see the whole city! Definitely a gem of San Francisco. It is a good place to include on your date in the city ;)
author: Kathy Z.

description: Loved the location and the steps. Parking was easy on the street which is a residential location. Climb the 163 steps all the way to the top and you will get great views of SF city. Then take another climb to the park at the top of Moraga and you would see more amazing sights at 360 degrees. You can see the tip of the Golden Gate bridge and downtown SF in the distance. Absolutely worth it. Kids and seniors in the group loved it. It can get very windy on some days so layered clothing is advised.
author: Manoj N.

description:
Before these stairs became a piece of art, I remember they were ghetto and falling apart. This stair art is considered the most beautiful and decorative steps in the world. 

YEAH SAN FRANCISCO!

People go up and down these stairs everyday around the clock. Your legs will look awesome after one round of going up and coming back down. When you get to the top, turn around, whip out your camera and enjoy the view. Do the same when you are at the bottom too.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Beautiful tiled steps. My 62 year old mother and I walked up the stairs. You can see the entire town. It is a most see. The locals say in the spring time it is very pretty because all the flowers are blooming. Hopefully next time I will get to see that.
author: Madeleine S.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE these steps! they're sooo pretty! Do yourself a favor and come here on a weekday as opposed to a weekend, so that it's less crowded.
author: Dominique F.

description:
this place, billy goat hill's tree swings, seward st slides... just a couple of my favourite places in san francisco.

pictures really don't do the tiled steps justice.  it's just way too hard to get all the detailing in one picture!  my roommate and i were lucky enough to go at a time that no one else was there, so we could get a good look at the entire thing.

the entire neighborhood is also pretty freaking cute.  when you're facing the steps, there will be a SUPER pink barbie looking house on your left when you walk down the street.  i recommend just walking left or driving left through the neighborhood because you'll see a lot of adorable houses that are very SF-y (:
author: Jennifer L.

description: The beautiful artwork on the tiles make the exercise worth it! There are many different designs and each one is very unique and detailed. Once you reach the top of the mosaic steps, you can continue up another hill to beautiful views of the city. Overall, a great spot in the city that is worth visiting.
author: Manogi M.

description:
Something to see if you're bored from seeing everything else in San Francisco. I mean how much of the Golden Gate Bridge can you see everytime you go to SF? 

The steps are pretty cool. My friend and I went here on a rainy day, Would've liked to the view but it's amazing by just looking at the steps. Each step had mosaic tiles so when you look at it, it forms an amazing piece of art work!

However, looking down, it looks like just steps. It would probably been more awesome if they did the other way around!
author: Crystal H.

description: It's amazing what they've done here. When I was in high school I don't remember much of it except that there was a lot of dirt and a lot less stairs at the top. When I visited again recently I couldn't believe how gorgeous the stairs were. And if you want an even better spot climb to the top of the stair and up the second hill that will provide probably the best view of SF from sunset! You won't be disappointed, unless you visit on a foggy day.
author: Kristen C.

description:
The most interesting and amazing staircase I have ever been to. You will also get a nice workout from walking these steps. I encourage you to continue trekking to the top of the stairs and go along the wooden staircase to the top of Grand View Park or what the locals like to call "Turtle Park." 

The mosaics is a very unique has unique quotes and individualized picture, but goes along with the overall big picture. 

It's a great place to take scenic pictures as well as taking in the views of the city.
author: Henry P.

description: What a neat and beautiful treasure of San Francisco!  We've been to the bay area many times and wanted something different to see, and found this spot!  So glad we drove out to find it!  We had fun taking pictures as we climbed the stairs and enjoyed the beautiful view from the top!
author: Judy S.

description:
GORGEOUS.

It's impossible not to be impressed by this stunning piece of public art.  Not only is it beautiful to look at (the amount of detail is so amazing! And its incredibly well maintained), but once you're done getting a workout going up the stairs (its actually not too bad), turn around and check out the magnificent view!!  I initially planned to just drop by to check it out, but ended up spending a few hours walking up and down, inspecting particular sections in more detail, and just drinking in the view.  I guess I should add a disclaimer that I visited on an absolutely fabulous bluebird day-- not a cloud in sight, and no creeping fog. 

LOVE IT.  A must see for locals and tourists alike!
author: Susanna W.

description: Great community project - artistic design and nice landscaping. Incredible views of the ocean
author: Duke A.

description:
A community project that has become a tourist attraction. It's not in a tourist area, it's in someone's NEIGHBORHOOD, so please do be courteous of the people who live there.  

We were able to park (yes, legally!) right near the bottom of the steps, and were the only ones there for about 15 minutes. My friends ran about halfway up, and came back down winded and giggling.  I photographed them running, and also some of the great flowering plants that line the steps. (We don't have plants like THESE in Jersey!)

From the top, the steps look ordinary. From the bottom- it's a collection of small elements that create an impressive whole.  (Probably a metaphor for lofty goals in life, or something profound like that.) Many of the tiles have the embossed names of local people and businesses.

We left when a French couple arrived. We took turns photographing each other in front of the steps, and then we left them to make their trek to the top.
author: AD J.

description:
How did I live here for three years and have no idea this place existed. If you want a great view of the Ocean, Golden Gate Park and the Sunset District, then you must come check these out. The titled mural is really pretty and it changes as you keep climbing the steps. 

Warning: If you are afraid of heights this may not be the best activity for you. I never thought stairs would bug me but you definitely gain some elevation as you climb up. The steps are also made of tile, so it's a bit slippery and it gets very windy. So glad a did it but just throwing the warning out there. 

Even if you don't climb up, at lease check out the view!
author: Marissa P.

description: i honestly thought it'd be way more majestic and awe-inspiring but it's just literally a few flights of steps - in a residential area no less - of the same picture/theme all the way up. i was hoping there'd be different sections of different mosiacs but i'll take what i can. was pretty hard to take pics with all teh shadows but after trial and error i finally managed to take a good one lol.
author: Joanne M.

description: A **BEAUTIFUL** mosaic running up the risers of 163 steps... Neat place to visit! Note - it's nestled in a neighborhood... I wonder if the ppl living nearby, especially next door get annoyed by random ppl parking/walking in their "hood". Somewhat touristy but not overly busy (as compared to Lombard Street a.k.a. The Crookedest Street & Twin Peaks), which may be a good thing for the ppl residing in this area; therefore you won't have to dodge too many folks while going up/down the stairs (hopefully). Though you might have to wait a bit to capture that perfect picture with your camera. Splendid views of the city from near the top. Great cardio via running up and down the steps. Btw not far from Grand View Park - which is neat as well.
author: Pina U.

description: A must see area for photographer, tourists, and locals. Sometimes a bit crowded, but there's a reason! It has some of the most beautiful art in the city of San Fransisco and is kept in tact. They have added another set of stairs like this close these as well if you just look around a bit hidden but just as worth to find them!
author: Isaac M.

description: I scheduled a stair day during my recent SFO trip, and this stairway was on my list.  Out of all stairways, this one was my favorite by leaps and bounds.  The mosaic tiles are simply beautiful.  When you get to the top, don't stop.  If you cross the street you'll find another set of steps which take you to Grand View Park where you will be treated to amazing views of SFO.
author: Christina M.

description:
There's always something to see in San Francisco and this is definitely one of them. I knew a stairway to heaven existed!

These steps are the perfect spot for some alone time. You can get quite a view from here and an even better one right across the street atop Grand View Park. This is surely community art at its finest, with local business names painted each step of the way that contributed to the project.

For all you photographers, it's hard to get a picture without getting photo-bombed by the hoards of other people, but there are techniques to get around that. In some cases, you can put yourself at the highest step possible where everybody else is below you to get a single shot. Except you're screwing with the people right below you and you're getting less of the stairway in the frame. If that fails, you can do what me and my girl Chloe G. did and just ask the person that's in the way to take the picture for you. That'll get them out of the shot! It's a win-win.

Hope, inspiration, motivation, whatever you need, this place has it. It's a sweet escape from all the shit you're dealing with. There's certainly a lot of beauty to be seen and felt here. A must-see if you're in the city!! Also, be sure to check out the sister Hidden Garden Steps nearby to complete the experience!
author: Peter L.

description: A great neighborhood attraction in San Fran! Great photo op with the tiled steps.. Climb even farther and you come to a set of stairs with an awesome skyline view!
author: Michael W.

description:
Beautiful steps decorated with tiles. When you get to the top, you see all of Sunset and the beach if it's a nice clear day. It definitely works your legs so it's a nice work-out as well. 

Definitely recommend :)
author: Jennifer H.

description:
What to expect when you get here:
1. Parking is not a problem
2. Mini-workout climbing the stairs
3. Witness the artwork
4. Experience the beautiful view of San Francisco
5. Camera ready
author: Chexll M.

description: This stairs are a beautiful proyect that many don't know about It, go in a sunny day, take nice pictures and hike until the top of the little mountain so you can enjoy of a pretty view,  I love the colors :)
author: Diana Sofia S.

description:
Hidden gem in SF. 

Great little walk up the beautiful mosaic stairs to a 360 city view. 

Great for locals and tourists. 

Enjoy!
author: Lina K.

description:
I love urban art installations just because you don't expect to see them! I mean, yeah, you see the big ones by the waterfront, but not the hidden gems in Sunset.

Fortunately for me, this place is an instagram staple, so I definitely knew about it. Let's just say that pictures DO NOT do it justice. It is amazing how much detail went into this huge vertical mosaic. Just thinking about it makes my OCD act up. I'm the type of person who wouldn't stop until she's finished with a project and god forbid I mess up one tile...

It was surprisingly sunny and warm today, so there was a sizable crowd gathered around to take pictures and exercise. Everyone was generally very nice about moving to the side so people could take pictures. 

There's plenty of parking on the street, but please don't block the driveways. I saw a line of cars do just that and I felt so terrible for the family stuck in their garage. Also, keep your voices down. We can look with our eyes, not with our mouths. There are people living in the hood.
author: Tiffaney L.

description: Great photo location! The tiles are amazing and if you read each one, they have different meanings... check it out
author: Jose S.

description: Absolutely beautiful hidden gem in Sunset. My only complaint would be that I wanted to take a photo when the stairs were lit in the sun, and only the top half was in the sun at 11am. Also, there were a ton of other people taking photos and some people working out by running the steps, so I had to wait before I could get a semi-clear photo of just the steps.
author: Jing L.

description:
On my bucket list of places for years, I finally made it over a couple of weeks ago.

Located in the Golden Gate Heights neighborhood, you'll spot the steps at the intersection of Moraga and 16th Av.

The tiles are very colorful with names of idividuals, families, etc who contributed to the project.

Climb to the top of the steps, and you'll be rewarded with spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean and sweeping views of the western part of the City.  Look northwest, and you'll see the Golden Gate Bridge and Golden Gate Park.

On our way down the steps, a runner and his dog were going to go up and down 10 times for their weekly workout.  I have to say my calves were tight the following day, so I can attest to the workout.  Better than doing the Stairmaster at the gym for sure!
author: Shirley N.

description:
This is an absolutely gem to find with your friends. I wouldn't mind come back again and again.  Yay for free parking, friendly neighbors, gorgeous artwork, and breathtaking view from the top.

The first time I went, I had a positive experience conversing with the neighboring lady, who was water the native plants planted along the steps. It's inspiring to think that so many people came together for this piece of art and that the neighbors are still involved in its maintenance! 

The 163 steps to the top felt like nothing because all I did was walk a few steps, stop and admire, walk a few steps, and stop and admire. Just be sure not to idle too long in case you're blocking the traffic. :P 

It also gets a bit windy, but that's San Francisco.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Warning Criminals break into cars all the time on 16th avenue and moraga by the steps. Don't leave a jacket either or a camera  They think there is a purse under jackets. Remember they are not prosecuted for the crime. Seen cars cruising and people looking into parked cars at all hours especially between 9-2 pm. Beware my friends had their eyeglasses stolen. It's terrible for the neighborhood
author: Maria R.

description: So Fantastic! My cousin went here and I have never seen something so beautiful. We went looking for it and we found it one morning. These steps are a piece of art that can be enjoyed by everyone in the city. We started at the bottom and started to walk up the stairs. I have to tell you, my ass and legs were on fire, and the closer you get to the top the stairs get steaper. Oh man, but the reward at the top of the stairs was priceless. Your can see the ocean for miles and all the of the houses lined up in the sunset. So incredibly breath taking! You can even see a little bit of the Golden Gate. This is a fun place to take some visitors from out of town or if you are looking for a quick and beautiful work out, go up and down these bad ass steps a few times and your bootie will be burning for days.
author: Lizzie D.

description: The 16th Avenue Tiled Steps are absolutely gorgeous. I simply have no words or pictures that can do this place justice.
author: Emily T.

description:
Start off with twelve steps.
Walk nine steps by seven flights.
Twenty two by four.
Total of one sixty-three
Beautiful intricate steps

Stare at the ocean
Amazing panoramic 
Stroll after eating.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
The steps here are awesome! If you're on Judah, you can run up 16th (a big hill), up the Hidden Garden Steps, and then you'll be at the Moraga Steps.

I came here on a clear day in SF. At the top of the steps you can see Ocean Beach. If you go up the steps near here, you can get to the top of Grand View Park.

There's around 163 steps here (+/- 2). It's a nice workout to go up and down it if you live by here.
author: Paul U.

description:
I found these steps purely by accident one day when I got off the bus one stop early. I looked east across 19th AVE and was blinded by its beauty. After a five-minute walk up Moraga from 19th I was blown away by the detail put into each and every step and I'd like to know of a more spectacular staircase in California. I see that all the reviews here are not five stars which leads me to believe there must be a more satisfying display somewhere else. 

As I was walking up each flight I would turn around to see the sun setting into the Pacific, pure magic. These steps should be in absolutely every tour guidebook because they are too special for just the few lucky residents of the Outer Sunset to enjoy.
author: Justin S.

description:
After spotting this on a Yelp list of fun simple things to do around the city, I made a point to go see it.  

Definitely worth the drive. Pictures just don't do it justice - one of those little spots that has to be seen in person!  We took our time at each step actually, to stop and look at the individual tiles....very cool project, it shows that a lot of work & care was put into it.

Like the other reviews say, you must of course hike to the top and look out.  A sea of residences - very cool.  I also really admired the greenery & flowers that had been planted for the project - a lot of succulents and a lot of flowering bushes that created a really pretty addition of color to the steps.
author: Anna S.

description: Residential parking at both the top and bottom of the stairs so parking can be tight.  This would've been something nice to see if not for all the people walking up and down.
author: Gavin M.

description: Beautiful must see spot in San Francisco! I ran into one of the creators while I was there and he told me about how everything was assembled and how long everything took and it was really interesting! He said it took the artist about 10 months to make each tile and the assembling process only took a few days. Absolutely beautiful artwork and you can even catch a glimpse of the city view from the top step.
author: Jenann P.

description: remarkable.. perfect place to get some cardio in and also for some great pictures. ENJOOOOY!
author: Jessmin Marie G.

description:
BEAUTIFUL. I was blown away by the detailing in the mosaics! I could probably spend HOURS here looking at each of the designs on the steps!

This is definitely a hidden treasure worth seeking out!
author: Kei H.

description: Absolutely amazing.Even the flowers and garden being taken care of on the sides, it was really nice to see the comment come together in such a simplistic way but with great meaning. Also one you got to the top with the amazing view, you could keep going farther up on a different set of stairs, seeing not only the west side of SF but the bridge and all corners of the city, it was quite the treat.
author: Luis H.

description:
Not only fun to look at, but a great way to get a workout in. Or just a slow walk to take in the beauty of the artwork.

I love that these are in my neck of the woods, out in the Sunset, and off the beaten path for tourists and even most residents of the city.
author: Maria M.

description: I live on 16th ave between both sets of stThere are two sets of Mosaic stairs on 16th ave. Make sure to check out both. The main stairs is sea themed with the sun and moon above. Beautiful and shiny rare reflective tiles. With a great view. Make sure to keep on going all the way up to the wooden stairs and check out grand view heights view. The best in SF! The lower 16th street steps are a jungle ground theme with a lizard and bumble bee and surrounding succulent plants. Its beautiful and also has a great view. More steeper than the main set of steps. Its best to visit these steps when the weather is clear! Enjoy!
author: Roman J.

description: Wow, what can I say, a free hidden gem. It was stir way to heaven. Love the stir decor and the view. Once you reach the top go across street and climb up to Grand View Park for a panoramic view of the city!  Got a great work out as well.
author: Ash M.

description: Wonderful steps. Well worth a visit off the beaten path.
author: Missy X.

description:
Whoa-oh...beautiful...gorgeous...LOVE IT!!!

While searching for short hikes in SF, I came across this on Yelp and thought, "wow! gotta check that out!!" So glad I did...it's absolutely beautiful. One of the many gorgeous things you see in the city where it makes you proud to be born and raised.  The love you feel from reading the dedications and realizing that each piece was strategically placed to make this mosaic staircase is breathtaking. Please go visit!!

Oh yeah, and it was amusing to watch the female being posed and photographed at the bottom of the staircase.  No, not a professional shoot or anything...jus amateur shooting, probably for Yelp or FB LOL

The view from the top of the stairs also provides a great landscape view of the Sunset.  Walking down the stairs is not so breathtaking but be careful cause it's a bit steep.
author: Ninja H.

description: Definitely a place to visit if you haven't already! I enjoyed art very much so seeing this mosaic steps and the many steps to walk on after a big lunch was perfect! Good way to enjoy art and digest your food. :)
author: Nhi R.

description: I had bugged my bf for months and kept saying that I wanted to go to find the stairs. At first we almost missed the spot since we were standing on the top of the stair and couldn't find any special of the stairs. And then few steps down, we realized the amazingly beautiful stairs were right under our feet! lol Then later when we walked around the area and tried to go down the hill to find a bus stop, we surprisingly found another secret stairs in a different theme (gardening)! Overall, I like it there very much, especially the residential area around there, where makes you feel relaxing peaceful, and the houses there are incredibly fancy and beautiful (of course they are crazy expensive!), and the gardening around the houses is gorgers and full of pretty flowers. : )
author: Fei-Chi L.

description:
Beautiful steps' art mosaic, beautiful views, just a nice hidden gem. 
Too bad some people feel like they can just leave their trash there. 
Please don't trash this place when you visit!
author: Busy P.

description: This place is beautiful and a workout with the steps! 100% RECOMMEND if you are in SF. THis was my first time at the place and it was in a quiet neighborhood and I actually felt safe in San Francisco LOL. There was not a lot of people, it's like a hidden jem in the city!!!
author: K D.

description: Nicely decorated staircase but giving this 5 stairs for just a bundle of stairs seems a bit inflated.
author: C S.

description: Must see for the art, thoughtfulness, details put into it, and did I mention the gorgeous view that comes with these steps the higher you climb it?
author: Kathy D.

description: So gorgeous. Amazing. Lovely. I need to check out Grand View Park next time but it was so foggy that you couldn't see a thing. You maybe wanna check out visibility conditions before making the trip out here.
author: Mel G.

description:
If you're visiting Twin Peaks, this is literally a 5 minute drive away. Public art in the city - awesome. Highly worth it if you're looking for some non-touristy places to adventure to (or climb). SF might be known for the Golden Gate Bridge, spectacular weather, and food, but the one thing missed is this.

If you're driving down 19th, this is just a 1 minute short detour off the Moraga intersection. (Really not much to say about the steps in particular... look at the photos!)
author: Kevin L.

description:
A cool little neighborhood gem. People do come here to exercise, but the best part about this local spot is the mosaic art. I've never seen stairs done up like that before. The shrubbery alongside the stairs are also well manicured.. the whole thing is just meticulously put together and taken care of.
Actually, I'm pretty sure the best BEST part is the view (from what I gather from the pics from other Yelpers), but when I went it just happened to be completely overcast. Maybe if I got to see the view, it would be five stars... definitely plan on going back to see it. Keep in mind that you have to cross the street and go up another length of stairs to see the view after getting to the top of the mosaic stairs.
author: Diana L.

description: I wore the wrong type of shoes to go exploring!  I first saw these steps on pinterest and since I just moved up to the area, I just HAD to find them!   You can't just come to admire the steps.  You have to walk to the very top!  The view is breathtaking!  When I got to the top of the steps I noticed more steps to the very top!!  ten times better than the view from the top of the steps so just keep climbing up!!!  I love these steps.  great work out and beautiful art to look at!  Will definitely come back soon.
author: Chrissie O.

description: AMAZING. Go here now. Coolest views in the city, and relatively easy to get to (compared to the Twin Peaks lookout). Word to the wise- this would be the ultimate date spot to watch the sunset from.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Step by step... ohhhhhh babyyyyy... I'm gonna have a heart attack, guuuuuu-url. 

Step one (one one)... This place is lots of fun.

Step two (two two) ... There's so much you can do.

Step three (three three)... It's art that is free!

Step four (four four)... We can run up them more!

Step five (five five)... Don't you know my heart attack has arrived?

Hey girl, in your eyes
I see a picture of this hidden gem all the tiiii-ii-ime.
And girl, let's stay a while
You got to know that these tiles drive me wild 
Step by step 
Ooh baby, they're always on my mind 
Step by step 
Ooh girl, I really think it's just a matter of dime.

Hey girl, can't you see 
I've got to have a thousand pictures of the stairs and me 
Step 
And girl, yes it's true, 
I come here for the view. 
Step by step 
Ooh baby, running these steps crossed my mind 
Step by step 
Ooh girl, I really think it's just a matter of my giant behind. 





Step by step 
Yeah, ooh baby 
I want you, I need you, I want a thousand pictures of these steps in my world.
author: T. M.

description: These steps are a great little treasure in SF. If you climb to the top and cross the street to a set of stairs, and cross the street those bring you to, there is another set of wooden steps walk up those & there is a cute little bench at the top of a hill that overlooks some of the city and over golden gate park. Love this place!
author: Callan B.

description: I LOVE coming here! Amazing view to watch the sunset, at the same time so peaceful.
author: Arlene B.

description: It's such an amazing hidden gem!  Pet friendly.  The husband and I came prepared with a bottle of water and a doggy bag for our doggy, Nacho.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Thank you Yelp for leading me to these awesome steps and helping me spice up my workout.  I went for the first time yesterday, determined to sprint up and down the steps 6 times before leaving.  

First round: Wow, there are waaaay more steps than I had initially thought.  Thighs beginning to burn.

Second round:  Feeling good halfway up until I look up and see I am only halfway up.  Thighs feel slightly cold from intense burn.
Third round: This was a terrible idea, I'm going to stop and walk.  Things are now jello.  Random tourists begin cheering me on and embarrassment at stopping forces me to continue the jogging up.  Make it to top, am a bit wobbly and very short of breath.

Fourth round: Random tourists, still cheering while drinking soda and ice cream.  Intense wheezing begins.  Make it to the top but look like a grandma crossing the finish line.  Random tourists call me out on only having done this 4 times.  I go again.

Fifth round: Can barely walk, my legs and butt are shaking and no longer stable.  Hobble to the top and collapse in defeat.  Random tourists somehow had beer stashed in their backpack and are now drinking a chilled Pacifico in training for Bay to Breakers they say.  I begin to hate the random tourists.

Sixth round: Canceled without feeling an ounce of guilt.
author: Johanna W.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, I was able to make a list of free things to do for my last trip to the Bay Area, and this was pretty close to the top. 

We arrived just before sunset, and took pictures all along the way up. The steps are beautiful from any angle, and the view from the top isn't short of amazing. It was a clear enough night that we could even see the Golden Gate over to our right. 

The Verdict: A spectacular view of public art, and the City. I'm sure I will make my way there again.
author: Cara S.

description:
Way cool! 
Check it out, and take the time to look at the tiles.  I only say that because there are some pretty cool individual tiles making up this beautiful mosaic of sea, land and sky... so just don't go running up those stairs to beat some Olympic time trials.
Tiles devoted to loved ones, cool businesses, and I guess due to my inner assholiness, my favorite snotty one "Eat My Shorts", just called out to me like a beacon in this sea of gazillion tiles.
author: Kara B.

description: The steps are soo pretty. Its a nice walk up and the view is amazing from the top. I came here a couple of times and I always see other people taking pictures here.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Just one of the most beautiful and artistic sights in SF. The stairs itself is very tall, good for jogging and cardio or brig your dog for a little workout. The art work in the stairs is amazing and quite the photo shoot site. Many people visit all day because it's free, beautiful, and located on a quiet street so this is definitely a tourist site to view and not have to fight through a crowd to check out and take pics. It's pretty quiet here located in the Sunset. Without a doubt check these stairs out and take plenty of pics!
author: Stephen C.

description: Such a stunning, affordable (free!) and accessible thing to go admire! Was blown away by the height of the stairs, the view and the artistry of the mosaic work. A work of great magnitude!
author: Carlie A.

description: Such a gorgeous piece of art! If you're in the Sunset area, you have to see it, and even if not, it's worth a visit. The trek to the top isn't as bad as it seems either! I'd been walking around San Francisco for hours before arriving at the stairs, so climbing those extra flights was the last thing I wanted to do. But walking up you're distracted by the beautiful mosaics on every step. When you get to the top and turn around, oh my goodness, the view is breathtaking!! You overlook all of The Sunset and the Pacific Ocean. I went around 4pm, so the sun was still shining bright. I imagine going at sunset would be even more stunning. Simply beautiful.
author: Maleenee B.

description: These stairs are simply amazing! They are a must see when visiting San Francisco. I have been to San Francisco numerous times to visit my brother, but I didn't find out about the mosaic stairs until about my 5 or 6 time visiting. I had already done the other touristy things, so I did a Google search for unique San Francisco and found the steps. I knew I had to see them and it was well worth the trip! The day I went there weren't many people there. The view is incredible! If you aren't tired of climbing up the 163 stairs, be sure to hike up a few more to Grand View Park. You will be able to enjoy amazing views of San Francisco, that is of course if the fog allows you too.
author: Virginia W.

description: The art on the steps is awesome.  Very colorful and creative.  Make your way up the stairs and plus more stairs to see part of San Francisco up high.  Definitely worth a stop of it's on your way!
author: Brandon L.

description: Beautiful mosaic artwork fills the sides of the steps.  It's a lot of steps to climb and it can get really cold, but the looking at the mosaic up close is worth it.  Plus, you'll get rewarded with a great view of the city when you're at the top.
author: Christine W.

description:
Very beautiful and colorful. It makes you smile even in the misting fog. It's gorgeous by the moonlight. It's fairly lit, so even at night you take a hike up the stairs. Watch out for the late night runner, he's friendly but preoccupied. 
Walk up and down to give yourself a new beginning.
author: Naomi K.

description: Beautiful and picturesque! Also looked like a great workout for the people running up and down.
author: Briana M.

description:
As part of my walking tour, came walking up from Dewey Blvd, Stairing up all the steps in the neighborhood leading to these steps.

These are really nice steps, and plenty of tourist come to check it out. 

Overall, I did 4000 steps in total on this day (Dewey Blvd, all the steps up to Kirkham, east to Forest Hills stairs, then west back to here).
author: qirk z.

description:
